From organising our pick up from the hotel and 2 tours also organising the drop off back to the airport was done with ease and never a problem at all by the guys at the front desk. also the hotel happy hour was a welcomed freind after a day of walking and touring was nice to come back to a Glass of red. Thanks again and yes stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Budget Conscious Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: msjeannettea
Reviews.Content: I came to the Elan based on Trip Advisor's reviews and it didn't disappoint me one bit. From the time I drove up to Valet to Check in, the personal attention I got from the Elan was great. The Wine & Cheese daily Happy Hour is a nice touch at the end of the day. For all you shoppers, it's only 1 block away from the Beverly Center! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mariferwaffle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at west hollywood, near Hollywood and Beverly hills, just behind Beverly Center. Its all about location!!! Elan seams that used to be an old building with renovations and the result its a cute small hotel!!! The best of it for me was the service. Everybody there were SO helpful and thats a really plus, for someone who is in LA for the first time! We arrived tired and late, about 10pm, and i have an amazing welcome!!! The check in was fast and the guy in the desk help us with tips about ATM, nearby restaurants. We did early quickly check out the next morning. They have a simple morning breakfast, continental breakfast and a wine and cheese service at the evening. We just came back to the hotel for picking our bags and were waiting for our cab and also offered us the wine and cheese service. For the price, the location and most of all the SERVICE, its value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireLottie
Reviews.Content: travelled with my husband and 6 month old baby. From the minute we checked in the hotel could not have done any more for us. We arrived in a U-Haul truck which was too big to go in the parking lot so they made space at the back of the hotel. Soft music playing when we entered our room. Great breakfast and the use of the microwave to warm baby bottles. Organised a cab to the airport which worked out considerably cheaper than if we had done it ourselves. The wine and cheese evening reception was my favourite part of the stay. A very civilised start to an evening and got to meet others who were staying in the hotel. All in all ann excellent hotel. Walking distance to main beverly hills attractions, The Ivy, Beverly Centre, The Grove and Farmers Market and Melrose avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - cannot praise it enough!”
Reviews.Author: foreverliz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Elan for 2 nights with my boyfriend in March 2010 as part of a longer fly-drive holiday. The Hotel Elan was the first hotel of the trip, and definitely one of the best. Location - The hotel was easy to find by car, just pull up at the front for the valet parking. Saying it's close to the Beverley Centre doesn't do it justice - it's literally a 30 second walk away! There is also a CSV pharmacy opposite, and a gas station next door. We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe at the Beverley Centre, and really enjoyed the food (massive portions!). The hotel is a 20-30 minute walk to Sunset Boulevard, and a short taxi ride to Hollywood. Room - We stayed in a deluxe double, and the room was a very good size with a large bed and a huge balcony looking out onto Beverly Blvd. Despite this there was no road noise at night, and we slept very well. The bathroom was large and clean, and I particularly liked the smell of the toiletries! Housekeeping were great, and the turn-down service with chocolates and the weather forecast was a lovely touch. There was a really useful information booklet in the room that included reviews and location of local restaurants. There were a large number of TV channels, and also free wi-fi. Facilities - Unfortunately we didn't attend the drinks and wine reception as we weren't back at the hotel in time on both evenings, but we did enjoy the breakfast buffet. It was well stocked with bagels, muffins, cereal, yoghurt, pastries, boiled eggs, fruit, and juices and coffee with take-away cups available. Staff - The staff were all extremely polite, friendly and helpful. The valet guys took me downstairs to the car to collect my sunglasses when I'd left them down there without any problem, and the reception staff were happy to give directions and recommend restaurants. As we only had one full day to see LA we decided to go on the Starline City Sightseeing hop on-hop off bus tour, which we boarded just outside the Beverley Centre (outside Macy's menswear entrance). We used two of the four available loops, and went to Hollywood, then through Beverley Hills and Rodeo Drive and on to Santa Monica, where we spent the afternoon on the pier. It was a great value tour which cost $30, you can buy tickets when you board the bus, no need to book. We also went out with some friends on Sunset Strip in the evening, and went to the Rainbow Bar & Grill and Mel's Diner, both of which we'd recommend (particularly Rainbow Bar & Grill for the generous spirit measures!). I really, really liked the Elan Hotel, and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Elan Hotel in April 2010. The hotel is located in the West Hollywood area, which provides easy access to Hollywood and Beverly Hills. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff each time we asked any questions. The staff really did go out of their way to assist as much as they could. Our room included a king bed, work table, safe, mini bar etc. The size of the room was fine and we heard no noise at all as our room was located at the back of the hotel. Breakfast is included in the price and comes with a variety of cereals, yogurts, bagels etc. There is enough on offer to fill you up for the day. The location of the hotel is good. It is difficult to get the ideal location in a city like Los Angeles which is very spread out. As we were only in the city for a few days we did not hire a car. I would certainly recommend hiring a car if you are staying in the city for any longer than a few nights. The taxis are expensive and the distance between tourist sights is further than it looks on the map! The big plus for the hotel though was the staff, they were certainly amongst the most friendly and helpful that we have come across on our travels

Reviews.Title: “Personal, friendly service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Su2116
Reviews.Content: Count me in as one of the many fans of The Elan. I booked 3 nights at the hotel based on the terrific reviews on Trip Advisor. The location was extremely convenient and the friendly valets made the $19/night parking fee a little more bearable. Everyone staff member I encountered at the hotel was extremely helpful. When I asked the man at the desk one night if the hotel had any vending machines because I wanted a couple of bottles of water, he had 2 bottles brought to my room for no charge. The hotel is in the heart of Beverly Hills/West Hollywood. The Beverly Center, CVS, Marshalls, Old Navy, and a coffee shop are within walking distance which made this NYer happy. I did not partake in the free wine and cheese reception in the late afternoons, but definitely enjoyed the free breakfast every day that included yogurt, oatmeal, cereal, pastries, bagels, juices, coffee, etc. Chocolate croissants, yum! I do have one complaint - when I checked in and was given a room on the first floor I asked if it was quiet. I was told it would be. However, I was awoken fairly early every morning due to my room's close proximity to the pantry where they keep the breakfast supplies. I could hear them pouring ice into basins and rolling carts back and forth. In addition, they were doing some painting and I was awoken by the sound of workers installing protective plastic on the floors. Other than that issue, I totally enjoyed my stay at The Elan.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ButteryBiscuitBase
Reviews.Content: Yeah its fine, but how it got number 1 in LA and number 2 in the US is beyond me, I can only imagine good marketing and lots of friends rating it. Sure its fine, basic, definitely not worth the 167 dollar a night when you add taxes and parking that we paid and definitely not better then the 48 dollar a night 147 vegas ranked tropicana so it bemuses me as to where it can get its rating. room was just about big enough, strange shape with shared courtyard out the window, large bathroom a plus but decor a little dated and breakfast was very simple and not worth getting up for. good location and we walked back from sunset after nice meal up there but overall i thought it very overrated.. see for yourself and maybe LA has terrible hotels but I also stayed in a quality inn down in hermosa beach which i thought was just as good.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Dermab
Reviews.Content: I really can't think of anything wrong with this hotel. It is in a very convenient location although certainly not in a "beautiful spot." We had a junior suite which had a nice sofa bed for my teenager. There was a free breakfast and wine and cheese in the afternoon. Although not a luxury place, it had everything I needed for my stay and because of its value, I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best & Cutest Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Chandnilepcha
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a place. Really, dont stay anywhere else when u're in LA! Loved loved loved the place... There are so many little surprises & pleasures u'll discover in the hotel. Cant stop raving abt this place!

Reviews.Title: “The very best position in LA for shopping at great value - Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneNoreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and booked the 3rd as we had a later evening departure to Australia. We booked The Elan because of the reviews on Trip Advisor having previously stayed at the Holiday Inn at Santa Monica on a previous trip. On arrival the staff were great and I had a requested a room on the 2nd floor it was not quite ready so we left our bags and went for out for lunch. This hotel has the best position for shopping with the Beverley Centre just a short walk away with a Macy's and other shops and across the road is the Beverely Connection with a new Ross and Marshalls stores plus Nordstrom Rack - across the road is Loehmans so I was in shopping heaven. Our room was not large but I knew that on booking but it was modern and spotless. The Australian wine and cheese served every evening between 5 - 7 is brilliant and welcome and the free breakfast is plentiful and fresh. We walked or caught a bus everywhere it is so close to Rodeo Drive and Hollwood Walk of Fame eetc and we loved every minute of our stay and cannot wait to get back there again. Betty Booth if your reading this thanks for introducing yourself and we will see if we can find a connection to the shared family name, it was great talking to you. Have to mention that we had lunch at a place called Souplantation in the Beverely Connection - great value for $8.99 all you can eat, salads etc. and also had dinner at PF Changs. Overall a great place to stay if you want to be in a safe area and brilliant shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Most quiet, elegant, and full service hotel for the dollars”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTiger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have already recommended this hotel to several of our friends and family members, and we just stayed there this weekend. I have yet to find a more affordable and first class hotel in my frequent travels to Los Angeles. We had to meet with several people in the entertainment business and the lobby was perfect for this purpose. The rooms are very quiet and polished with all ameneties, and the staff is on par with the best of the 5-star hotels. Plus who can beat the complimentary wine and cheese hours while watching the street through the picture windows. We will always check availability at this hotel first when coming back to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaryandMelody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights from February 21st based mainly on other reveiew of this hotel on TA. The hotel is very small and we stayed in a Junior Suite on the second floor with a small balcony door for fresh air and a skylight for natural lighting. The room size and comfort of the bed were very satisfying. Also, the free Australian wines and cheese tasting between 5.00pm and 7.00pm were very welcome. All of that said, this is a very small hotel with limited resources, which is made up in some way by its location. We had some good meals locally, there is a fantastic little bar (door in the wall in La Cienaga) called "Rogers" and say hello to an excellent barman (ex Aussie) named Damien. We would stay here again because it represents value for money, however, I am puzzled still, at the hotel's number one rating in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Sitting in my room, sad to leave tomorrow a.m.”
Reviews.Author: LesterLou
Reviews.Content: With the most friendly hotel staff you could ever imagine, a filling breakfast with great coffee and plenty of healthy options, and a free wine and cheese reception in the evening, you can't go wrong. I agree with others that the room is a little small, but it is not at all bothersome because I don't spend much time in it. Very clean, simply and stylishly decorated and a comfortable bed. Parking is $19/day, but it is valet and it never took more than 2 minutes for my car to arrive out front. Free wi-fi! Chocolates on the pillow along with a little card showing tomorrow's weather are just two more examples of simple touches that make a big difference. I would absolutely stay here again. It has been a peaceful haven after a busy day of work, driving all around the LA area. I'm actually sad to leave tomorrow! And again, simply a top-notch staf!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jobyhere
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in the Elan Hotel and have nothing but praise for the experience. Things that were great are numerous but to list a few that were important to us: taxi collection - excellent efficient collection for the same rate as standard; arrived really early am and yet the hotel were happy to accomodate two weary travellers with breakfast and early check in; room was great, beds really comfy, pillows full, decor is of a chic quality with many little extras that helped like perc coffee, robes, ice bucket etc. Toiletries all fantastic. Breakfast included a big bonus and of course free internet and two hotel PC's that were easily free when we wanted to catch up with family. The cheese and wine although sounds different is really good quality and a great addition that sets the hotel above others at this rating. Finally as others have said the location for us was perfect. 5 min stroll to great shopping perfect. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone in particular wanting a great location for a brief stop over like us. Thanks to all the Hotel staff for making our stay so welcoming. Oh, and I should mention that the booking and communication with William prior to arrival and also upon landing felt very personal and made us both confident about choosing The Elan Hotel. Keep doing what you are doing !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - only complaint is the tour recommended”
Reviews.Author: ches_perth
Reviews.Content: I decided to trust the Tripadvisor recommendations and booked the #1 hotel (Elan was ranked #1 at the time I was making my bookings). I am glad that I did. Location was great for catching the "DASH" and the 105 (metro service). I booked the King Junior Suite and was given a room that faced the internal courtyard. I didn't mind as that meant a quieter room. Loved the continental breakfast in the morning - great start to the morning. The staff at the front desk was very friendly. The only complaint that I have was the Starline tour that was recommended at the front desk. Future reference for anyone interested in doing a tour is to check the Starline website - we found we paid more than $20 more per person because of booking throught the hotel. We booked the second Starline tour online and saved $12 per person...

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, a Great Place To Stay In LA”
Reviews.Author: ghodgkins
Reviews.Content: After years of assuming that chain hotels were the safest choice, I've learned my lesson. The Elan Hotel is the first hotel I've stayed at that delivers on every single one of its promises. If you need a place to stay in LA, check out the Elan Hotel. It's located one block from Melrose, one block from the Beverly Center, one block from 3rd Street restaurants, etc. This is one of those rare instances where what you see is what you get, and what you get is top-of-the-line quality and service at real-world rates. No BS.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: archiebabs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a month long trip around the world - 2 parents and four children 12, 14, 16, 18. Didn't know where to stay read trip advisor and took the plunge and it was perfect. Central to everything and with the knowledge and friendliness of the staff our 3 night stay was just right to fit in what we as a family wanted to do. THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location, friendly staff â€“ a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: peggyss
Reviews.Content: They have done a tasty job of making this into an attractive, friendly place, with a nice space in front for lounging or enjoying the free continental breakfast, which is very good. The rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated, not spacious by American standards, but fine. We were disturbed by noise in the hall - a little late at night which may have been other guests - and early in the morning each morning - which seemed to be staff. Usually we turn on the hvac fan or the bathroom fan and leave it on to mask ambient noise, but it wasn't possible to do that at the Elan. The neighborhood behind the hotel is lovely to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but #1? No.”
Reviews.Author: Rik411
Reviews.Content: Pros: Front Desk staff very friendly and responsive. W. Hollywood location close to Beverly Center and not far from Grove mall. Also close to the I-10 and La Cienega. Free breakfast was pretty good (great Zucchini bread) Cons: View from the "Junior Suite" was horrid. $219 Junior Suite was very small (for a "Suite"). Room was freezing cold (in fairness - had a bizarre week of cold and rain in L.A.), but they could not regulate the A/C and finally gave us a room heater. Finally, workout room had been converted to conference room (when?), and guests have to now walk 4 blks down the road to the Beveral Fitness Center (for add'l $12/day). All in all, not a "bad" place to stay, but surely not "#1 in LA". Le Parc Suites (where I stayed last year) is much better, and only a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: krih
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and son) stayed here for 2 weeks. I cant say enough good things about this place. The staff are so warm and friendly. The hotel has a lovely relaxed welcoming atmosphere. The rooms are kept extremely clean, with a card left with the weather forcast for the following day. They are environmentaly concious. Complimentary wine and cheese every afternoon between 5.30 and 7pm. Breakfast is more than sufficient. Complimentary internet and computers are awesome. We LOVED this place. See you again soon ELAN

Reviews.Title: “Great value...”
Reviews.Author: mhope3244
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Elan Hotel on Jan. 6th-8th. The hotel was small but very clean. There is no bar; however, the staff has wine and cheese from 5:00-7:00 p.m. You are truly in the heart of WeHo in walking distance to a lot of good restaurants and chic bars. The staff was fantastic and very friendly. The bell captain hooked us with a great "watering hole" only three blocks through the local neighborhood. Perfect. The desk clerk hooked us up with Jose' who is the hotel's driver. We paid Jose' around $150 to drive three of us for two hours in his Hummer around Hollywood Blvd, up Mullholland Drive and back down through Beverly Hills-Rodeo Drive area. Take your camera because the views from Mullholland were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Elan is a little gem”
Reviews.Author: ajbsydney
Reviews.Content: My family (including two teenagers) stayed for 6 nights over the recent Christmas period and had a very enjoyable time. We found the hotel very comfortable and well positioned. As we did not have a car we used public transport - the DASH and metro buses - which were cheap. The West Hollywood location of the Elan was good and we were able to get to various sites from here on public transp[ort including the Getty Museum, La Brea Tar Pitsand Santa Monica/Venice Beach. There are plenty of good value restaurants within walking distance of the Elan. We enjoyed the free wine/cheese provided by the hotel early evening. Free wireless internet access and two computers in the lobby meant you can stay connected during your stay. The staff at the Elan were very helpful during our stay. As an example, my eldest son turned 18 on the day of arrival and we really appreciated the birthday cake and balloons for his room that were provided by the hotel. GM Joel Majors and his staff were helpful throughout our stay and we would definitely stay at the Elan again when next in LA.

Reviews.Title: “ELAN IS A BREATH OF FRESH AIR WHEN IN A FOREIGN CITY”
Reviews.Author: englishgirl99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elan for 3 nights at the end of my honeymoon from Jan 3rd to Jan 6th. I cannot believe it is only a 3 star and not a 4. The service was fabulous, free internet, cheese and wine was lovely the valet parking excellent! The bed was huge! The hotel is trying to be as green as it can be using eco-friendly toiletries and having a card to not change the sheets every other day.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service, everything you would expect.”
Reviews.Author: goranb
Reviews.Content: I hired a deluxe room with a double bed for myself and the room was clean, comfortable and very well appointed. The staff were friendly, helpful and approachable at every encounter. The continental breakfasts were a great start to my mornings with a wide variety of food available, and the wine/cheese evenings a great way to socialise with some of the other guests. The location is great with Metro and DASH bus stops nearby and the Beverly Center only a few minutes walk away. In addition, this area of West Hollywood seems more pleasant than a lot of LA as I did a lot of on-foot exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: jjxj
Reviews.Content: I don't know what kind of standards these guys who gave this place 5 star reviews have, but they're not mine. - The place is clean and well furnished, but it's located in an anonymous street near a big mall with nothing else really around except some diners. - Half the rooms face the "courtyard" which is actually a glorified airshaft containing four anemic looking potted trees. - The only way to get some air is to open a big sliding door, which means that anyone who wants to can just walk into your room. - In the first room we had, the sink didn't drain properly, and they forgot to give us shampoo, etc. - The walls are very thin. We were kept up all night by someone coughing (poor thing) in the neighboring room that we shared a wall with. - The internet didn't work. There was free wireless and free in-room wired internet. The wired internet didn't work at all, and the wireless was slower than a dialup. The staff was very pleasant, but that can't make up for the fact that this place just isn't worth the money. Next time I'll go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok but I don't understand the #1 rating...”
Reviews.Author: global_traveller_888
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the good reviews on TA. Well I must say I am a bit disappointed. It's partially my fault for not researching the area a bit better. I first stayed at a hotel in Venice Beach and really liked the proximity to the beach and the activities around there. I changed because the hotel in Venice Beach had a very high weekend price. The location of the Elan Hotel is ok I guess. It is right on Beverly Blvd and near the Beverly Center but I personally did not like the area too much. It seemed a bit scruffy and not very appealing to me. Also Beverly Blvd is quite a loud street and my room was facing the road which meant that I could here all the trucks and cars passing by the whole time since the room did not have an sound proof at all. I could even hear the voices of people walking on the sidewalk. I personally was not that bothered by it but still it was a bit annoying. So I would recommend people who are sensitive to noise to get a room facing away from the main street. Check-In staff was efficient but not overly friendly, just ok. The room itself was very nicely furnished and everything was working fine. Housekeeping is probably the best asset of the hotel as they really took care of the room with a lot of attention to detail and really made an effort. Breakfast was quite good with a good choice of items from cereals to bagels to hard boiled eggs. Valet parking was OK but a bit annoying since you always have to wait for them to get the car in the garage next door. It would be so much easier if they would have self parking. However since it's Beverly Hills, you are stuck with valet parking almost everywhere. So I guess if you want to be in Beverly Hills then stay there, if you are a first time visitor to LA I would not recommend it, since traffic around there is pretty bad at times and the freeway is not really that close to go to places. I guess the experience was ok but that's all. I will not come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Basically a renovated motel trying *really* hard to be a boutique hotel...”
Reviews.Author: VegasPisces
Reviews.Content: ...and for the most part, they are getting it right. But, unfortunately, there is only so much you can do with a building shell that was obviously a former motel. To provide a bit more background about my travel style, and therefore expectations: I am a TA devotee. When I travel, I always consult TA first and then make my travel plans accordingly. Everyone who knows me knows of my faith in the TA community and our honest, helpful reviews. When my mom and I were planning this short trip to LA, I told her that I would plan the hotel and assured her that she was in good hands. She is more of a hotel brand name follower and I'm sure would have preferred that we booked with Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, since those brand names give her comfort - and for good reason, since they invariably deliver on their promise of luxury, often at a price. Back to the Elan - when we arrived at the hotel and pulled up alongside where the valet station was located, I could feel my stomach drop. The website, while only providing limited pictures and none of the exterior of the entire building, certainly did not prepare me for what I was seeing. As I mentioned above, the exterior showed a two-story building that was most likely a former motel or travel lodge. The lobby was small, but nicely decorated, as were the rooms themselves. It is obvious that considerable renovations were done to this property, as the furniture in the room had little extra touches, such as wood trim and a flat screen TV. Also, the shower head and water pressure in the bathroom were superb. But unfortunately, the room itself was extremely small, as were the "balcony" and bathroom. I was also disappointed with the quality of the linens. Most distressing was the room's heating mechanism, or more accurately, lack there of - the instructions on the unit were extremely confusing and even when we figured them out and did as instructed, we were still left shivering in a very chilly room! Given the attentiveness of the staff, I feel comfortable that someone would have come to lend a hand if we had called, but we were so tired from being out all day during both days of our short stay, we were simply too tired to hassle with it and just bundled up for bed. Some high points - the breakfast buffet provided a lovely array of baked goods. Also, the location was right down the road from the Beverly Center and close to freeway access. Unfortunately, the road on which the hotel is located (Beverly) is rather busy and the traffic was a bit noisy at night. The free high speed internet really was free and really did work, which was a nice surprise. Overall, this wasn't a bad property - but honestly I was expecting so much more given that it is rated as #1 in all of Los Angeles! This is the first time that I have ever felt let down by TA reviews, and unfortunately I now fear that it has made a skeptic out of my mother. I would not return to this property because I feel that with the great number of hotels within the greater Los Angeles area, there is probably somewhere that I would enjoy more. But I do give kudos to the owners and management of this property for making the most of what they have to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Despite intial appearances, you very quickly come to understand the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller70
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor, and although on first site of the exterior we were a tad disappointed (especially given that we were paying more to stay here than we had at the 5 star Wynn in Las Vegas), we soon came to understand the great reviews. The staff cannot be faulted and were very professional and hospitable - better than we've had in some 5 star hotels!!! Even the cleaners made you smile as whilst they don't have the nicest of jobs to do, they do their work smiling and laughing with their colleagues yet managing to do a good job. Michael (Front Desk) deserves special mention. There was a small mix up on arrival - we were given keys to a room which was still being cleaned; Michael gave us keys to another room and told us to take a look, and if not, we could wait for the other one (ask for a room facing out rather than into their atrium area as these rooms can be dark. Also, following recommendations from other Tripadvisor guests, we had also requested a room on the 2nd floor). We waited for our room and were immediately sent up a bottle of decent wine as an apology. Apart from the charge for parking (discussed later), there are no hidden costs at this hotel which makes a nice change. Internet, Breakfast and wine & cheese in the evening (decent wine, cheese/crackers could be better) were all complimentary. Breakfast is decent: bagels (toaster available), danishes, muffins, hardboiled eggs (cold), yogurts, cereal and a selection of tea and coffee and fully available from 6.30am (as we found out on the morning of check-out - much appreciated). Rooms are small but nice. We had problems with the heating and so found ourselves in reception each evening, and whilst they tried tweaking their computers, there was no change in temperature; in the end we took up their offer of a portable heater - so my recommendation here is ask, and they will try and help.. Good supply of towels. Nice beds. Good location, being situated in West Hollywood; as near main road, very easy to get to Hollywood and Beverly Hills. To stay here (and probably anywhere in LA) you would need a car. Big shopping mall 2 mins walk away (Beverly Centre) and plenty of places to eat - have a look at the info pack in your room which gives you a list of good restaurants which are walkable distance, and others that you would need to drive to. The Grove (posh eating/shopping/cinema complex is also only about 10 mins away in a car). There is a charge for Parking, which with taxes is $21 a night. Whilst the thought of paying so much for parking is not a a nice one, it is worth it given the lack of parking in the vicinty (very confusing signage). They park your car away from the main road, but we never had to wait more than a few mins for our car and the valet staff were very friendly and courteous. My suggestion is to just budget this into the cost of the hotel stay and then forget about it. In summary, whilst by no means cheap, this hotel is probably very good value given the location and the fact that decent hotels in LA are not cheap. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm amidst the hubub of Los Angeles!”
Reviews.Author: llaney
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Elan Hotel and couldn't have been more pleased. Have stayed at several other nearby places (Beverly Laurel and Farmer's Daughter) and the Elan was so much nicer! The lobby is warm and inviting. The staff was friendly, helpful and a pleasure to talk to. After checking in, we were greeted by name every time we returned to the hotel after an evening out or a daytime excursion. Very "personal" service! Although there is not a restaurant on site, the complimentary evening wine and cheese (5pm to 7pm) was a delight, with an abundance of cheese, fruit, and lovely wines. Likewise, the "continental breakfast" (which is included in the room cost) was replete with breads, fruit, yogurt, cereal, coffee, tea, juice and even hard boiled eggs! Displayed nicely in an alcove off the lobby, it was a lovely way to start the morning. The hotel also has a "room service" agreement with a neaby restaurant that will deliver food to your room until midnight (!!!!) and without the standard delivery fee. In addition, "Jan's" (a fine, well-known coffee shop) is just across the street, and there are several other restaurants on the block. Plus the Beverly Center is only about 100 yards away. The room was large and furnishings were up to date and comfortable. Plenty of outlets for charging the cell phones, GPS, and oh yes, the FREE wireless internet connection was a bonus. I am soooo tired of hotels charging $175+ a night for a room PLUS $10 or more per day for internet service -- such a ripoff! The FREE wireless connection here was reliable and if you didn't bring your laptop, there were three computers downstairs in the lobby, available 24 hours a day, for guest use. Guests also have access to the nearby health club for that morning workout! Parking is valet-only with in-and-out privileges. The car was safely ensconced in the underground parking area (not out on the street) and easily accessible for retrieving a pair of sunglasses and then later, a jacket we had left in the back seat. I travel to the area often and will definatley make the Elan Hotel my new home away from home. It was a pleasure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great!”
Reviews.Author: puppasmurf
Reviews.Content: Agree with all other good reviews listed here. Comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Stayed in room 225, Junior King Suite. King bed with entertainment area (couch,coffee table and stocked bar fridge) and business table. Quiet room, No traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “LA at it's best”
Reviews.Author: KymSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: Having returned home from a very long holiday and gathered my thoughts at last, I would like to post a review of the Ã‰lan Hotel Los Angeles you can't go wrong staying there, 4 stars to the Ã‰lan we stayed at the end of September, the room was a decent size, with a large comfortable King bed, nice and clean room with pleasant decor, good size bathroom, large flat screen TV ,it is very nice indeed and what a location diagonal across the road from the Beverley Centre were there is good shopping, movies theatre's etc, there are also nice places to eat next door or just around the corner, Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times and they had a sense of humour too We had some wonderful days walking around LA, doing all the tourist things , Walk of fame, Chinese theatre, Johnny Rockets for lunch, Farmers Market & the Grove, Tar Pits etc how good was all that so all in all, if you want a good hotel to stay in, right on good shopping outlets, nice eating, drinking etc with in easy walking distance of the hotel in nice area, with rates that wont break the bank this place is for you

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: elbi
Reviews.Content: The Elan Hotel is a great place to stay. We were here for two nights recently and really enjoyed our stay. On our first night we had a room close to reception on the first floor and it was a little noisy. When I went to the front desk the next morning and asked if we could move, they were more than happy to oblige. We left to spend the day at Universal Studios (a $30 cab ride away) and returned to find not only had we been given a new room with all our stuff moved in to it, we had been upgraded to a king sized suite - which was just lovely. The staff were so helpful, booking cabs, recommending places to go/eat and just generally very welcoming. The hotel offered an excellent free breakfast (bagels, fruit, cereal, great coffee) and even a wine and cheese reception each night - what a bonus! Another bonus for us was free internet access. We didn't travel with a laptop so it was nice to be able to check our emails. The location was great and although we had to cab to most places, my experience is that it's nice to be away from the hustle and bustle if you want a good nights sleep. I read the reviews here and booked on recommendations from other travelers, now I can do the same - you should stay here. It's a great place and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves #1 spot”
Reviews.Author: NicoleN
Reviews.Content: I am just going to reiterate what all the other great reviews say. This is the best hotel we have stayed at in LA. All the staff are amazingly friendly and helpful. The decor: bright, modern and relaxing. Rooms: quite (no traffic noise) spotlessly clean, best beds and linen ever, large flash TV, great bathroom products. Foyer: Great for mixing with the other guests. Breakfast was the best continental ever (great coffee) and I loved the wine and cheese in the evening (good old Jacobs creek you canâ€™t beat it). The use of the computers was a great bonus and free wireless invaluable. $19 for valet parking but thatâ€™s cheap in comparison to most LA hotels and it makes life so easy having your car nearby. It was only a 15 minute walk to the farmers market for supper in the evening (beware food stall shut @2100) Beverley shopping centre across the road and a short walk to loads of restaurants. Itâ€™s simply a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChgoGal11225
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Elan in early November and was so impressed and satisfied with the experience. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The lobby was lovely -- modern and comfortable. My room was gorgeous and so clean. The cleaning staff did a beautiful job each night -- replenishing all the toiletries and coffee, and the little chocolates with the turn-down service was very nice. Huge TV with HBO. Quiet room -- even with my window facing Beverly. No hallway noise. Parking does cost $19/night, but after the first night of valet parking, I found that street parking was very easy 3-4 blocks away from the hotel in the residential areas. (That only applies for Sat-Sun -- might be difficult during the week.) Still, the room rates are reasonable, so paying for parking isn't as painful as it could be. (Especially when I consider parking in Chicago hotels overnight is $45-50.) Oh, and the wine and cheese/crackers every night was SO nice -- and normally I wouldn't think I'd enjoy this (travelling solo as I was) but the lobby was so comfortable and the cheeses were so delicious, I loved it. And the continental breakfast was fantastic. I can't imagine a nicer place to stay in all of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother staying anywhere else in LA!!”
Reviews.Author: tangy_4u
Reviews.Content: Elan!! i love this place so much! I started my 3 week trip around the state here and after travelling around staying in various places i can say without a doubt that Elan is the best place i have stayed hands down in the US. I'll start with the rooms - massive and always clean, loved big screen tv for chilling out after a night out.. Air con works great and the beds are the biggest most comfortable hotel beds ever. The guys at the front desk and valets are awesome as well. I didnt talk much to the morning shift guys as i was generally straight out the door, but i spent alot of time chatting with the night guys after my night out and they sure are great for a chat. A quick story why they are so great - i had a hire car and needed to fill up gas before returning, but the gas station have dodgy people tryng to hustle me so i got out of there - when i told the night valet guy (john) about it, he jumped in the car with me and filled it up for me!! where do you get that kind of service? only from Elan - legends location is awesome - the beverly centre is right there and the big freeway to get you around isnt too far either. also can you say free wireless?? - everywhere else in the states wanted to charge me but Elan set the standard again :) We loved this place so much we booked it for our last leg in LA before heading back and listen up Aussies - they have vegimite! vegimite on a bagel = win general tip for LA - get a car because LA is spread out I'm heading back next year and will definately stay at the Elan. See you next year boys Big David

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable base for exploring LA”
Reviews.Author: bullets69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elan while over for the Breeders Cup World Horseracing Championships at Santa Anita. A good welcome with upgrade to a larger room. Great comfortable hotel in good safe location. Loved the breakfast (most hotels in LA don't do breakfast) and the evening wine and cheese. I had a problem with my laptop charger and housekeeping were helpful in sorting it out. The Beverly Centre is the nearest main landmark and a great place for shopping. A short bus ride away is The Grove - shops, farmers market and cinema - which is worth a visit. Would definitely stay at the Elan again. I loved LA so I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: fmcmartinb
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in LA as a precursor to a prolonged road trip around the South West. We wanted an inexpensive hotel in a part of the city we'd feel safe to stroll around day and night. The Elan, manager William and staff provided the best possible start to our trip. Arriving by taxi from the airport at 21.30 we were met at the door, checked in and shown to our room in the most courteous fashion and in double quick time, but not before we'd learned that the hotel provides cheese, wine and coffee each evening, gratis. The evening's offerings had been cleared away but, realising we'd be hungry as well as tired after journeying all day, the staff volunteered to serve it all again just for us! Not only that but when the repast arrived it included a bottle of our favourite Aussie red wine! The rest of our stay was equally comfortable, the staff being just as happy advising us of bus timetables and bus stop locations as arranging for another guest's hire car to be upgraded to a Hummer! They were also very helpful in arrangingtours etc. The location was all we could have hoped for - a stroll around the block before breakfast was through a delightful residential area; we walked out at night and felt perfectly safe locating a bar and restaurant some blocks away. Top marks for the Elan.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with flawless customer service”
Reviews.Author: bearhandler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find. The location is central, The rooms are relatively quiet, and the design is subtle and calming. For a longer stay in particular, the professionalism of the staff is very impressive. I have stayed here twice when in LA for work and will definitely be back. The only drawback is there is only valet parking - so if you have a car, which you're likely to in LA, you have to either spend another $15 a day on valet or figure out the complicated street parking regulations and move your car a lot.

Reviews.Title: “What a find in LA !”
Reviews.Author: SusanfromMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Elan Hotel for 3 nights last week. The service was second to none and very personal from the admin staff in the back offices , guys on the the front desk,valet parking and the housekeeping staff. We were greeted personally and asked about our day by everyone we saw ,they could not have been more hospitable. The breakfast included in the tariff was relaxed and generous served in the foyer of the hotel , we met there again in the evenings for the wine ,cheese and fruit reception, were they served fine Aussie wines !!! When I had a few hiccups in getting out of LA they were supportive and helpful with some good suggestions. They also have some preferred taxis drivers that were cheaper and safer than others we used.They organised 2 day trips for us giving us great suggestions on what to do.The hotel is managed by a couple of Australians that are attracting a good clientele, many business men but also lots of Aussie accents there having breaky! More a boutique type of hotel and very safe for women travelling alone.Would highly recomennd Elan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay at the Elan if ever in LA again”
Reviews.Author: suzmcon
Reviews.Content: Terrific, friendly and helpful staff. Rooms had everything we needed. Great location, yet quiet rooms. 3 x computers in the lobby with fast internet access + 1 printer. Happy hour is put on by the hotel each evening serving Aussie wines + cheese at no extra charge. A yummy breakfast is included in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nive to look at, but terrible for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: mcourt83
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positive, but ultimately, I'll need to end with a big negative--one that will prevent us from ever staying here again. The hotel lobby is lovely, obviously recently renovated to pass for 2009 chic. The staff, while sparse, is friendly and helpful. The neighborhood, while slightly seedy on the surface, is close to the Beverly Center and a few blocks from Melrose and Santa Monica Blvd. Our room, while VERY small, was clean and stylish. And now, the bad. Our room was located on the first floor and abutted Beverly Blvd. I've never stayed in a more noisy room. The noise from the traffic and passersby was unbearable; we hardly slept all night. On one hand, the price is right, which is why I suspect this hotel is so highly rated here. Our room, with a AAA discount, was $152. On the other hand, you get what you pay for. If you can't sleep in a hotel, then you've chosen the wrong one. We chose the wrong one.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean boutique hotel in great location with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: SusiePTexas
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I stayed here for a long weekend (3 nights) in October '09 and were quite impressed with everything about this hotel. It is a small (2-story) boutique hotel in a great location. When we first entered the front doors, we noticed the beautiful lobby area. The hotel is within walking distance to many nice restaurants, stores, and a very nice huge (3-story) mall just one block down Beverly Blvd. When I stay in hotels, it's all about "cleanliness" to me. I am the pickiest of anyone I know when it comes to cleanliness, and I was definitely satisified here. Our room (and bathroom) was immaculate! Our beds were some of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in with very nice (and very expensive) sheets. Great fluffy pillows too! Our room had a nice big flat-screen tv, large desk with re-charging outlets for cell phones, and free wi-fi. Nice fluffy bath robes, house slippers (new in plastic packages), ironing board w/iron, and blow dryer were also provided . A refrigerator is also in the room which we used for our bottled water. Our room was on the bottom floor, and we were never bothered by any outside noises, i.e., traffic, etc. It was very quiet and relaxing. The bathroom was big and roomy with a good "strong" shower head and lots of hot water! (No low water pressure here!) A few added extras were the lighted swing-out make-up mirror mounted on the wall and the full-length mirror on the inside of the bathroom door. Every morning a free "continental" breakfast is served in the lobby area. It was one of the best continental breakfasts I have ever had. They had a large selection of pastries (croissants, donuts, muffins, bagels, fruit-filled pastries), several cereal choices, fresh fruit, and for drinks: coffee, orange juice, and milk. I normally don't partake in these free continental breakfasts, but this one was "over and above" the standard. Also in the lobby is a computer center (with several computers and printers) which is available free of charge to hotel guests. I never utilized them since I had my laptop with me, but I noticed other guests using the computers frequently. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. They were all very professional (& professionally dressed!) and always greeted us with a smile. Regarding finding a place to park, you must valet-park in their parking garage. There are a couple of street parking spaces on the side street that runs alongside the hotel, but you must move your car by 8am. I didn't want to have to run outside to move my car each morning (and where would I move it to???), so for $19/day (plus tips to the valets), you just pull up to the front door, and they will move your car to their underground parking garage. Each time we left, they brought our car to us within 5-10 minutes. I normally don't valet-park, but you don't have much of a choice here. Plus, I knew my car was going to be safe parked in their "valet-parking only" garage where no other guests or outsiders had access to. Another plus with being a guest here is the daily 5pm wine and cheese reception in the lobby......and did I mention that it is "FREE!!!" I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting L.A. that wants to stay in a nice clean & quiet place, wants to stay somewhere centrally located (15 minutes to beaches, Hollywood Hills, just minutes to Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive, Sunset Blvd., good restaurants, shopping, and many other fantastic L.A. sights), and wants awesome service!

Reviews.Title: “Confirmation of excellence”
Reviews.Author: DeJos
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in september 2009 and I just have to confirm what everybody else wrote about this hotel. This is just an excellent hotel. If I would return to LA, this would be the place! Friendly staff, always available for any information. Close to the Beverly Center, if you want to do some shopping and a great sushi restaurant (cafÃ© sushi) 1 block away... Extra's: Internet-pc's, Wi-Fi in the rooms, complimentary wine reception from 5pm to 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “booked because of reviews and didnt disappoint”
Reviews.Author: cabbie61
Reviews.Content: I mainly booked this hotel based on the reviews and location and price and wow we werent disappointed. Great location, great rate for such a location. The rooms are nicely appointed abeit not massive but then you re in LA so you are not spending much time in your room and if you dont care if the hotel has lots of facilities then this is the place!! The staff are very friendly and accomodating here. The wine and cheese party is a novel idea and to my surprise esp as it is free they serve you good wine too! The breakfast is excellent. Only thing this hotel lacks is a pool. Apart from that i would recommend it to anyone and will def stay there again if back in the area. Dont be deceived by the outside of it either as it is a lot nicer inside. EXCELLENT ALL AROUND!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for three days (two nights) last week and were very impressed with all aspects of the hotel. The location, cleanliness and value for money are great but what absolutely sets this hotel above others is the outstanding commitment to customer service. As this was my first visit to LA I did quite a lot of research and chose this hotel due to the positive reflections in other reviews. After booking I made enquiries from the hotel regarding getting from LAX to the hotel. William suggested a fixed rate option with a taxi and made all transport arrangements for us with the whole process going like clockwork. We were met inside the terminal by Caesar (taxi driver extraordinare!) who collected our luggage from the carousel and whisked us into LA to be met at the door of the Elan by Paoulo who took our luggage direct to our room. The service remained at this standard for the three days with any request, from just general info to tour bookings responded to immediately with no fuss. The room was very quiet and clean with two double beds so just perfect for us. The bathroom was modern and spotless. The complimentary wine and cheese at 5pm each day was delightful and a nice way to unwind before dinner. We also appreciated the weather forecast delivered to our room when we returned to the hotel in the evening as we could plan clothes for the next day. This was particularly helpful as the temperature increased by 12 degrees (to 88) on our second day. Overall, I could not fault any aspect of the hotel and would highly recommend the Elan to any traveller. It will be the only place I stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: AH0106
Reviews.Content: What can I say that others already have nt, every review about the staff, location, cleanliness etc is spot on and the Elan cant be beaten on value for money. The staff at this hotel are fantastic, nothing is too much trouble for them. Location was perfect for us, we had a car and did not have to drive far to Sunset, Melrose, Rodeo. As I wanted to spend time in the city and on the beach, I booked into another hotel in Santa Monica after this hotel thinking it would be too far to drive each day, I did nt need to, it was only 20 minutes drive to the beach. I am definately going back to L.A and definately going back to the Elan. PS One tip for anyone who hires a car, there are 2 parking spots on the road at the side of the hotel, they are free between 6pm & 8am. You can also park for 2 hours at a cost of $2 (make sure you have some quarters)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Top Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jennyspark
Reviews.Content: I booked this little hotel after reading reviews here and was not dissappointed. This is not a luxe hotel but the rooms have been very nicely appointed are super clean and the free broadbrand and breakfast a great bonus. Nice comfy beds too, love the ipod docking station and big screen tv. The Hotel is in a great location pretty central to everything and close to Beverly Centre and all the cool restaurants, and is across the road from a great little diner( Jan's) . What makes this hotel so great though is the staff. They checked me in a good couple of hours early, were super helpful and friendly and willing to answer all my questions and point me in the right direction for everything. Big shout out to Paolo who helped out everyday and was always super friendly and had a smile! Will stay with guys again when i am back in LA.

Reviews.Title: “again reviews were spot on”
Reviews.Author: jimiUnanderra
Reviews.Content: as all my hotels were booked based on reviews on trip advisor and again could not have been more impressed.very comfortable with clean and modern rooms,free internet connection contnental buffet breakfast and every afternoon complimentry variety of cheeses,biscuits and plenty of red and white wine.bus stop out the front for 25cents hollywood dash was very convenient for most of hollywood sights.staff very friendly and helpfull and would not hesitate booking this hotel when in los angeles again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessofNile
Reviews.Content: My experience at Elan Hotel was really good, amazing location in a very class place in Beverly Hills, 10 mins away from Sunset Boulevard by driving. The hotel crew were extremely extrovert and helpful. Bedroom is huge, cosy and luxury. The only negative thing I could easily hear people talking and walking outside the hotel as my room was on the facing the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there just as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Satch1SouthWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan two years ago and decided to return this year as we enjoyed it so much last time. We were certainly not disappointed as it was just as good as we had remembered - if not better, as it had been refurbished. It is really peaceful and calm and the service is excellent - everybody is really friendly and can't do enough to help. We had booked two queen rooms and were given free upgrades to kings when we arrived. The hotel offers a good breakfast and we took full advantage of the free wine offered from 5 - 7 each evening!

Reviews.Title: “Well Located. Great Value. Would Go Back.”
Reviews.Author: jc2400l
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is an excellent option for LA. The location was very close to many places we wanted to go. The hotel is well furnished, clean, well-maintained and comfortable. Service was friendly and capable. Free breakfast was a very nice added bonus. We were never there for the free afternoon wine, but that was a nice offer as well. We found it easy and convenient to park on the street close by, and valet parking was also offered. My only complaint is that there was no pool. Not the most amazing hotel I have ever experienced, but for the price I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: dsikula
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we really enjoyed out stay, but there were pluses and minuses. First, the minuses: The cost of the valet parking. I realize the hotel is in West Hollywood, but $19 a day seems a bit steep, especially when self-parking under the hotel seems a viable option. Then there's the noise. Our first room was next to a prep area for the buffets, so starting very early every morning, we got a blast of tinkling glasses and rolling carts. We were also subject to hearing loud conversations in the lobby. And on the second afternoon, a mysterious buzzing/rumbling began that didn't let up for the next 18 hours. It wasn't loud enough to prevent sleep -- but was just under that threshold. And cell phone accessibility is spotty. Oh, and of the three public computers in the lobby, only one is connected to the printer. Not necessarily a problem, but when one woman spends more than an hour surfing on and printing menus from seemingly every restaurant in the greater Los Angeles area, it can be a little frustrating. Those caveats out of the way, we had a great time. When we told the staff about the above-mentioned noise, they were johnny-on-the-spot about investigating and moving us to a new and far quieter room. The staff is the hotel's biggest plus; unfailingly friendly and efficient, they're gems. (On checkout, when a false honor bar charge appeared on our bill, the desk clerk took it off with no argument, and on our final night, when we arrived back at the hotel quite late, they offered us the option of a later checkout.) The beds are very comfortable and the amenities are quite nice. Showers are a little lacking, but acceptable (even if the boiler went out for a while on our second morning). Location is great, central to many things, and all in all, we were quite comfortable and satisfied..

Reviews.Title: “SO GOOD I STAYED 71 DAYS!!”
Reviews.Author: LongStayerLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed 71 days!! April into July of 2009. I had been a patient at Cedars-Sinai and decided to convalesce at nearby Elan Hotel. Was I ever in for a treat! Wolfgang Puck coffee in each room, plasma tv's, high thread count sheets, spa-worthy toiletries, mini-bars---the attention to detail by the staff is simply unparalleled!! Couple this with the COMPLIMENTARY BREAKFAST + GOURMET CHEESE and WINE BAR and it's an unbeatable venue. Somewhat of a family feel, yet they know the meaning of privacy. As a single female, I felt extremely safe and protected. Very well run hotel--the GM, Joel Majors, is highly-regarded and has trained his entire staff with impeccable standards. I truly felt as though I was at a Five-Star Hotel...but without the price. These people really know how to do it right!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great simple and stylish boutique hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nick_WashDC
Reviews.Content: Over the past 3 years, I have stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern several times. It has been a consistently excellent experience. The hotel is small (no restaurant), but stylish, clean, and modern. The staff are professional and helpful. The rooms are somewhat small, but have very nice amenities: comfortable bed, terrific pillows and linens, iPod docking alarm clock, flat panel TV, minibar, cotton robe, iron and ironing board. I also very much enjoyed the early evening wine reception--something I don't usually go in for. It was in the lobby, which has nice large windows, and the atmosphere was casual; the wine was decent; and the cheese and salami were nice. Finally, what keeps me coming back (and hopefully will continue to keep me coming back) is the great location and the reasonable price. The hotel is central to most destinations and is in a class by itself in terms of quality for price value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ofiraf
Reviews.Content: Me and my Husband stayed 2 nights at the Elan hotel I searched for some time hotel in Beverly hills area that won't be that expensive and I'm so happy we stayed there the Location is EXCELLENT!!! close to everything, Beverly shopping center is just around the corner and all other main attractions few in drive The hotel itself seems very modest from the outside, but the rooms are excellent, clean, large, what ever you need. also free internet at the lobby and printer that's very helpful if you need to print your boarding pass or directions. very nice breakfast included in room price one issue is the parking. there is only valet parking for 20$ in the hotel, it's not unreasonable for LA, but there is free parking at the street starting certain hour and I think also on Sunday so before you choose know that there are other options. I choose the hotel because it was highly rated here, and now I know why!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdwest
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Los Angeles, and am thrilled to have made the Elan Hotel my 'home away from home' during my travels to LA. I have stayed in a number of hotels throughout downtown LA, West Hollywood and Long Beach, and find the Elan Hotel to be superior in every aspect. The staff is outstanding. William, Caren, and the other front desk staff will do "whatever it takes" to make you feel at home. Valets Paolo, John and the others are quick to bring your car from the underground garage, or to carry bags if needed. General Manager Joel Majors is available for questions, comments, and suggestions. The hotel itself is located one block east of La Ciegnega on Beverly Blvd. There are dozens of restaurants within a few blocks walking distance, shopping at Beverly Center or The Grove are just blocks away; and the CBS production facilities are no more than a half-mile. Tourist destinations such as Sunset Blvd, Rodeo Dr, and Hollywood & Highland are within 15 minutes drive (or taxi) from the hotel. The rooms are pleasant, if small, with good amenities. LCD TVs with cable, mini bar, Manager's Wine & Cheese reception each night from 5-7pm, and other amenities await. The hotel has a relationship with a gym two blocks away that offers excellent work-out facilities. Breakfast is continental, with bagels, muffins, danish, toast, yoghurt, fruit and hard-boiled eggs. Coffee is from Wolfgang Puck, and is really tasty. Rooms include coffee machines to "make your own." Within two blocks walk is the Stone Rose at the Sofitel (if you want "high end" entertainment, pay a bit more and see "Young Hollywood") as well as the St. Nick's Pub (for a more down-home "beer" experience). Several options exist inbetween as well. Free high-speed internet is offered throughout the property. I recommend this hotel for business travelers coming to LA as well as anyone who wants a high-quality boutique hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: Maryloou
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we had a problem with our room. The first night the was no other room available and therefore we couldn't change. The following day we received a new room and the staff was amazing trying their hardest to make sure we had a great stay, and we did. The location is perfect, walking distance and/or short driving distance to shops and restaurants. There is a Sushi place next door to the hotel. We tried it and it was delicious! We sat in the bar and got to see the chefs do their magic with the rolls and sushi. We came back more then one time and both time we were just as happy and pleased with the food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: fun2travelCanberra
Reviews.Content: Before arriving in Beverly Hills I was worried about the location of the Elan Hotel, but it was in an excellent location close to everything in Beverly Hills. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Although the room wasn't large, it was clean and comfortable which was more important. The hotel is modern and not so big as to be impersonal (but it does have an elevator, which some hotels don't have). It has free interent. Value for money was outstanding. My criteria for a good hotel is to ask myself the question: would I stay there again? The answer is yes, I certainly would stay at this hotel again. The only negative comment is that our room was not serviced until late in the afternoons after we had had tiring days out sightseeing and were looking forward to coming back to a clean, serviced room. Overall it was a very good stay at the Elan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: LordBY
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice and very well located. The rooms are a little bit small, but everything is new, clean and modern. The hotel offers free internet access at the lobby and a very good breakfast. The only complaint is about the room service, which was a little slow when we ordered food. The lobby attendants were all nice and very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jmintouch33
Reviews.Content: From the moment our taxi pulled to the curb the Elan staff were there to help. We arrived at 9.00 am in the morning for a 3.00 pm in checkin and we were lucky enough to be able to get into our room. Checkin was smooth - and the room was outstanding. But it was the personal level of service that we received that made this motel outstanding. The desk was managed 24 hours a day so it didn't matter what time you stumbled in the door or out - someone was there to greet you and answer questions and solve problems. The morning breakfast was a perfect start to the day - enjoyed in a beatifully appointed lobby. You could sit and talk with other travellers - swap notes and ideas or just read the paper. And each evening was rounded off with a wine and cheese get together for interested guests. Elan was an excellent launching pad for Los Angeles - it is across the road from the Beverley Centre - has restaurants in the street (the italian Trattatoria was superb), and the bus to "anywhere" is on the corner. We used public transport for all of our adventures - and loved the 25c dash! Travelled comfortably to Universal Studios and Santa Monica using the buses and trains. And each day the Elan staff answered our questions - printed out timetables, maps and schedules and even helped us with elusive change for the bus! If you are looking for a central location in beautifully appointed accommodation, with friendly, personal staffing support at an affordable price - Elan should be the first place you research.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, presentation and service, congratulations Elan!”
Reviews.Author: markandsuec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Elan on two separate occasions in the past 10 days and were totally blown away by the extraordinary level of service provided by the staff and manager of the Elan. From the moment we arrived, (earlier than we should have), everything happend smoothly and nothing was too much trouble for the staff to arrange for us. (like car hire, tourist bus tickets, luggage storage for a few days, etc, etc). The immaculate presentation was a delight to find and the complimentary 'wine and cheese welcome' held each evening in the lobby was excellent.,.. a great way to break the ice and meet some fellow travellers. The Elan is just a stroll from the Beverley Centre shopping mall and various restaurants (including the superb sushi cafe just 100 metres away),. and the hop-on-hop-off tourist bus service which is also brilliant. So if you are looking for a great location to base yourselves in LA, we cannot rate the Elan highly enough in such an otherwise expensive city. It is outstanding value and we will be staying there again. Our congratulations to Joel and his staff,..this is one hotel we will defintely recommend to all our friends! Mark Currie. Pacific Palms, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: YvesCanada
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel!!! Can't say enough good things about my stay there. Booked 4 nights at the begining of May and enjoyed every minute. Great staff, location,room, super clean, great breakfast every morning and the hotel is small so not noisey or too tourist-y. Wine and cheese every night was a great way to start the evening. Perfect location for shoppers or those sight seeing. Look around for less expensive rates-they are out there. But, for LA the hotels rates are not that bad! You should check it out if you are going to LA .

Reviews.Title: “Shhh it's a secret”
Reviews.Author: CHAMUCO1
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to thank HopSkipJump for making up my mind on the Elan in W Hollywood instead of the Celebrity hotel, I am sooo glad I did not stay in Hollywood. The hotel is one block from La Cienega Blvd where you can catch buses any where in the city, believe me I went everywhere; weekends though are lousy for taking buses, sometimes they don't come at all. The hotel is small, not really a boutique hotel, just small, but you feel like a part of a family unlike say staying at the Sofitel up the street, paying more than double and not having anyone notice your existence. Omar at the front desk is a sweetheart, always a smile and a hello when he saw me come in in the afternoons. Check-in no hassle at all. Room 206 one queen bed, inside room VERY quiet. Room is small but I was alone so it was fine. Great bed and bedding, 4 great pillows and 4 throw pillows besides and an extra one in the closet. Iron and ironing board in closet too. Desk and chair and internet connection and a large flat screen TV. Small bathroom but adequate with very nice toiletries. Yikes!! no hair dyer and I didn't take one!! No problem, I told Karla the housekeeping girl that I had thought I had read there were hair dyers in the rooms, she said she'd see what she could do and of course when I got back that afternoon there was the needed item. There is also a free in-room safe which I didn't use, I just locked everything in my suitcases and it was fine. Having breakfast included is heavenly. If, however, you need eggs over easy or pancakes or anything substantial you'll do better going across the street to Jan's Restaurant, more on that in a minute. The buffet breakfast has yoghurt, granola, cereal, milk, orange juice, coffee, hot water for the lovely teas they offer, danish, muffins and bagels and yes, they have cream cheese. There's a toaster and a microwave and oh, on a couple of days they had the most heavenly freshly baked banana nut bread. They also have a fruit bowl with bananas, apples and oranges. Breakfast is from 6:30-10:30am. There is also a little outdoor terrace for breakfast for you smokers or those wanting to enjoy the morning sun. I never got around to the wine in the evening, I always got back to the hotel late after siteseeing and shopping. They also have one computer in the little lobby so you can check your email at no extra cost. Jan's Restaurant is right across the street, but of course you have to walk a block one way just to cross and then a half a block to reach the restaurant. They serve breakfast all day and night so one night I went all out and had a big breakfast and on my last night I had dinner there; prices are fair and the food is decent. Take a bus from La Cienega to Sunset and you have all the hot night spots and restaurants or stay on the bus and it will take to straight to Hollywood. Walk a couple of blocks to 3rd street and hop a bus right to The Grove, or go the other way and head to Rodeo Drive. You can get any where you want from the Elan by bus. For you shoppers you have within 3 blocks of the hotel, Beverly Center with Macy's and Bloomingdales as anchors; Lohmann's Men across the street and a block up Lohmann's women's. There is a Grand Luxe CafÃ© where I ate twice, expensive but I was on vacation. Not only is this a great hotel but ALL the people that work there are so very nice and you can't beat the price and it includes breakfast. I would definitely stay here again if I am ever in LA, the area is so much nicer than the Hollywood kitsch.

Reviews.Title: “Just when you believe the stigma that everyone in L.A. in superficial and uncaring...Enter the Elan Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: RossiD82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was basically a dear friend of mine' s home-away-from-home while she resided in a different city and worked in L.A.. The hotel staff has become family to her and continue to be since she relocated there. When she was going through a particularly trying time, I was SO BLOWN AWAY by their above-and-beyond care for her (now, and over the last couple of years), and in particular of ths trying time for her, when all of us were in town for a funeral. Even though she no longer resides at the hotel, during the week, I'm really glad she has such incredible people close by who are friends and I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Highly recommended. Amazing staff, great people - everyone from the manager, valets, front desk, housekeeping - you know who you are - you are all Soooo awesome!!! Thank you for all you did for us and my friend. Words cannot express.... Oh...and Love your hip ambiance too by the way!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with Style & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: maruskaiv
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers to Los Angeles (having lived there for 18 years prior to moving) and know all of the hotels in the area. Staying (for the first, and definitely NOT the last) time my husband and I were happily surprised that all of the positive Trip Advisor comments were accurate. The staff is excellent: friendly and accommodating. No sooner had we entered our room we received a call from Omar inquiring if the room was to our satisfaction and if everything was fine. The room was immaculate, the linens were soft and welcoming. Late afternoon wine, cheese and dried fruit was a special treat for all guests~a very, very nice touch! The breakfast was plentiful and beautifully presented. Thank you very much to all of the staff and we will return in a few months ! Mary Ann & Ron

Reviews.Title: “Get past your first impression”
Reviews.Author: rjs121
Reviews.Content: When we landed at the Elan, it was after a fair drive from Vegas and I have to admit I had concerns. It is on a busy boulevard which I wasn't expecting (probably naively) and we had just stayed in the best hotel in Vegas so I had to try and be objective. Recpetion was really efficient as was the valet for the car. We had a room at the front of the hotel which was adequately big enough and very clean. The service was good, especially when the newly installed cable broke on four occasions in the first 36 hours. The gym with which the hotel is assocaited is really good and really close (and if you're into running, don't run outside in LA unless you want an asthma attack - seriously). Breakfast was really good - lots to choose from and constantly re-stocked. There's just one thing-the moise of the traffic. We both had ear plugs and boy, did we need them. The traffic doesn't stop all night. Try and get a room at the back although I'm unsure as to whether this would be any better. However, this was still a good hotel in a convenient location providing you have a car in a city where it's difficult to know where to stay if you haven't been there before. Personally and with no detriment to this hotel, I'd stay next time in Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice place at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Becky28
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on this hotel over the Easter weekend. It is a lovely small hotel in a good location (there is no such thing as a good LA location - you have to drive everywhere). You can walk due south onto 3rd if you want to eat and drink without getting in the car, or drive to most places pretty easily. Two minor negatives: 1. the breakfast is only so-so. Continental style, but the quality isn't great (e.g. muffins aren't tasty). 2. the rooms are small, as others said. I wouldn't want to stay there for more than 3 nights in a row... it would get oppressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great no-frills hotel a block from Beverly Center!”
Reviews.Author: EugeC
Reviews.Content: The Elan Modern Hotel is a pleasant surprise for business and leisure travelers seeking a no-frills hotel to spend the night at a great value. Travelers seeking to enjoy spacious lobbies, fancy restaurants, and athletic facilities in their hotel should probably stay elsewhere. The Elan Modern Hotel features friendly staff, clean well-furnished rooms, a good breakfast, and a short hop to Beverly Center shopping/dining. However (very minor issues), the hallways are a bit antiseptic and the hotel is a not located anywhere near a subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “The Elan is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazuza
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern to be with a family member that was having surgery at the nearby, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center. It was a rush last minute visit, so it was nice to get a hotel within four blocks from the hospital. The hotel has wonderful employees, everyone goes out of their way to make sure everything is satisfactory. I was given a handicapped accessible room. I think it was the last available room on short notice. The hotel location was great, not only was it a short walk from the hospital, but it has a variety of restaurants in the area and the Beverly Center is within walking distance. I didnâ€™t have a car, but valet parking is available. The room was spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable. The television was flat screen with Hi-Def and there was a coffee maker in the room. The bath was very large and clean.
