As I mentioned the room was accessible so the doorways were large and there were grab rails in the bath. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. There was juice, coffee, tea, pastries, yogurt, fruit, bagels and cereal. If I had any complaints it would be that the room I had was next to the front desk so there was some noise from the lobby only in the morning. Elanâ€™s location is convenient, not only for the hospital but for shopping, sightseeing and getting around in general in Los Angeles. When I come to Los Angeles next, I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: wendydiana
Reviews.Content: Fresh and beautiful, decorated in modern style with clean lines and relaxing colors. Perfectly located for business or leisure, surrounded by great restaurants and shopping, and convenient to all local attractions. This hotel offers everything travelers need for convenience and comfort. Beginning the day with a healthy and refreshing breakfast, and ending with a relaxing afternoon happy hour of cheeses and wines - all complimentary. Staff is very professional and helpful. Rooms are bright, very clean and comfortable, and eco-conscious with earth friendly bath products. I have stayed at numerous luxury hotels throughout Los Angeles and Beverly Hills, and this is definitely a luxury class hotel without the luxury class price! An absolute must for any traveler looking for ease, comfort, style and value.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Right”
Reviews.Author: Calm
Reviews.Content: And how often can you say that? We were visiting our son and chose The Elan, partly, because it was two blocks from his architecture studio. We enjoyed easy walking excursions to The Farmer's Market, Museum Row (the LACMA was fantastic), and the West Hollywood/Beverly Hills area. Beyond the great location, everything about the Elan was, well, right. The room was thoughtfully designed and refreshingly well kept. The staff was unfailingly friendly. Breakfast each morning was a delight and the evening wine and cheese reception was a great respite after busy days of sightseeing. All in all, we can easily say that we've spent a lot more money to stay at much less desirable hotels. Great job, Elan.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: itravelVancouver
Reviews.Content: I would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to everyone. Excellent location. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Loved the nightly complimentary wine and cheese. Complimentary breakfast was also excellent though would have liked healthier choices. Only thing missing was a pool, work out facilities and on-site restaurant which I usually prefer to have in a hotel but it really didn't make a difference to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend - read for tips!”
Reviews.Author: roxysugar7
Reviews.Content: For the money, the hotel was awesome. The staff was super friendly and even printed us directions to each of the touristy spots we wanted to hit. The breakfast each morning was filling and wine/cheese reception each night was unique. The computer with internet access in the lobby came in handy as we mapped out our days. The overall location of the hotel is great. It's very safe feeling and there's a 24 hour drug store within walking distance. Shops & nightlight were a quick drive away. Only negative aspect was that the rooms were small, but again... for the price, it wasn't bad at all. Tips: - Valet parking is $19/day and well worth it - there are in/out privileges and that saved us hassle as opposed to looking for spots on the street. - Get up by 10:30 for breakfast - it's not a gourmet feast, but the coffee and pastries were a nice way to save a few $$ on breakfast. - Ask the staff for suggestions. We ate at the best brazillian steak house and took a trail to hike to see the Hollywood Hills based off their suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: motogirl2000
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Elan hotel was most memorable, the staff was great, I felt very at home, The lobby decor was inviting, along with the room decor,love love love the 700 thread count sheets and down comforters.Their continental breakfast and wine and cheese reception was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SharonStansfield
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Elan whilst visiting Hollywood. For the price it was excellent, great room with really comfy bed and nice linen, good bathroom. Staff were really helpful and it's in an excellent central location.

Reviews.Title: “International flavor”
Reviews.Author: N0sDa
Reviews.Content: I will go back to this hotel, if there is a room, whenever I visit LA. It is charming. The complimentary breakfast was excellant. My husband and I enjoyed the wine and cheese in the evenings. The hotel is centrally located and we were able to walk to the mall and in the neighborhood. The clientel was from several different countries which added to the flavor of the experience. The service was very pleasant and helpful. The room was a bit small but quiet, clean, comfortable and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: nataliamaridaki
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I stayed in during the 20 day honeymoon at the states, if not the best one and I must say I stayed at intercontinental chain hotel, too. My husband loved it. He would like to come back some day. The hotel is charming and the rooms were so cozy and clean. Free internet included, perfect price (199$) for a perfectly located hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially the parking guys. I was really amazed when I realized that breakfast was included in the price (an exception for american hotels) and actually it was quite a good one. I will definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “LOOOOVED the Elan!”
Reviews.Author: nyctravis
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazed at how great this hotel was, especially in its price range. I used to live in LA so was a bit weary of this hotel that I didn't recognize, but decided to give it a try. It's in a great location within easy walking of many shops & restaurants (esp the Beverly Center). Rooms were super clean and very nicely decorated. The lobby was modern but also quite comfy and really lended itself well to sitting and chatting with friends or colleagues. They had a pretty nice breakfast (with good coffee), and a very nice wine & cheese reception in the afternoons. Amenities were all upscale with "green-friendly" products. Bathroom was sparkly clean. Nice flat screen TV's and free wi-fi. Never felt nickle and dimed and was astounded at how many complimentary offerings there were at the low rate I got for the room. Staff were outstanding. When it was raining (which I wasn't expecting) they saw me without an umbrella and promptly offered to let me borrow one. When the lounge computer/printer was in use and I was rushing to print some documents for a meeting, the front desk staffer offered to let me email them to him and he printed them for me right away and had them delivered to my room. Not a single mention of a charge or fee or even the slightest hint of inconvenience. Very impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and deal”
Reviews.Author: corycov
Reviews.Content: We decided drive up from SD to see the Getty. Booked 2 rooms for 1 night but had so much fun we added another night. Rooms were smallish but nice. I was there with my parents and two young children (2 and 6). The breakfast was great, the kids ate whatever they wanted in the lobby, and wine tasting were excellent, pretty much an open bar. There aren't all the amenities of some other places, but we were after the amenities of LA. We have stayed at the Avalon many times, but never used the pool, the service was spotty, and the attitude was high. The Elan also has a great location, and we just parked on the street and with no problems. We will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service/Excellent Location/Extremely Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: dragonsneakers
Reviews.Content: The Elan is a little bit of heaven when you are far from home. The night auditor (Raphael) was wonderful, and made sure that I had that fresh cup of coffee, as soon as I came down to the lobby, regardless of what time it was. Caren at the front desk arranged a dinner reservation with the finishing touch of delivering directions for the restaurant, and having the wait staff at the restaurant, bring us a glass of champagne at the end of our meal. Brian, Omar, Effrain, the sales rep. Simply wonderful people as each brought something special to the stay. The valet (Effrain) went out of his way to make our lives and parking issues a minor thought, and even offered to drive us to the restaurant for our dinner reservation. Overall, this hotel is excellent, reasonably priced, and filled with an extremely competent and friendly staff. They go out of their way to ensure that every guests needs have been met. The daily wine and cheese tasting, brings hotel guests together making this hotel feel as though you are visiting friends rather than being at a hotel. Although smaller than the large chains, this hotel is immaculately clean, and rivals the larger chains in customer service. An absolute gem in Boutique Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Elan is a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ravyn007
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get much better than the Elan hotel as far as prices and quality of the hotel itself. Since the Elan does not have a pool (something that is quite common for LA hotels), it is a bit cheaper than other hotels in the same class but don't be fooled by price. The Elan is elegant, the rooms have ample space, flat screen TVs, and are nicely decorated. The hotel is small (I believe it's two floors total) and provides complimentary wine tasting every night between 5 and 6 PM. The hotel also provides complimentary buffet-style breakfast until 10:30 AM. There is no restaurant within the hotel but who needs one when you have all of LA's great restaurants from which to choose?! It doesn't have the view that a tall, high rise, hotel would have but it is a lovely place to stay while in LA. Centrally located in a very nice neighborhood which is more residential than the busiest part of LA (closer to Hollywood Blvd.). I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We rented a car (and drove up the coast from LA). The staff is very friendly, accommodating, and professional. Some things you should know about the hotel before booking: - The Elan is not within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd. You will have to drive about 10 miles or grab a cab for that but a lot of nice things are within walking distance of the hotel itself. - Try the Urth Cafe right around the corner for a quick, healthy, but yummy meal and a fabulous iced, blended bubble tea or coffee! - If you have a car, you can park it under the hotel for approximately $19 a day. The valet staff is available 24 hours a day and were both courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kkarundia
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Elan based on various reviews we read on trip advisor. We had managed our expectations before we checked into the hotel. However, don't get fooled by the slightly shabby exterior. The service and hotel, bioth are very nice and homely. THe hotel is centrally located next to the beverly centre. Sunset Blvd, Farmers market are either walking or US$10-15 taxi ride. We did not rent a car in LA, but were surprised to note that the public transapotration is very good. There is a DASH busstop right around the corner from the hotel which takes you to Hollywood Highland for a mere 25 cents. Other good restaurants are close by too. I was particularly impressed by the level and quality of service at the hotel. Quick response, helpful concierge and free internet and wine and cheese everyday. Definatley look this hotel up next time you are in LA. One thing to be careful about is do not order from Jan's family restaurant opposite the hotel (they have an arrangement with this restaurant since they do not have room service). The food is terrible and they do not even take your order properly on the phone. Try taco bell instead. Both open till 2am everyday

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of work”
Reviews.Author: ABC12326
Reviews.Content: A bit dissatisfied - some mistakes were somewhat corrected. Decided to give the Elan a try - am an LA native and now live on the other side of the world. The rooms are nice, soundproof to outside noise, great location, free WiFi, however I had decided to use valet parking-when I went to retrieve my car (after 25 hours in the valet) was told they'd given my rental car to someone else. Over 90 minutes went by that I spent on the phone between LAPD and rental car agency, reporting the car stolen. Coincidentally the other guests who'd taken my car arrived just then, but I felt this was a huge legal liability. The GM comped my parking (of course) and also comped one night's stay to help clear the error. This error probably won't happen again, however would not valet after that, which was a great inconvenience to have to move my car around the permit-only streets. There was also one night that the aircon was completely out (had to sleep with windows open). I wouldn't stay there again, but hopefully the management has sorted out the problems for future guests.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: fremantlewa
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Elan hotel and cant recommend it enough. We had a ground floor room - just behind reception. We were worried it would be noisy but there was no problem at all with noise. We had free internet connection for our laptop - but for those without their own PC - they had one that you could use for free in the lobby. Breakfast was included - it was a light continental but that is all we needed. Some toast and juice was enough for me but they also had bagels, muffins and pastries. They had Wolfgang Puck coffee (I found it bitter but others liked it) The hotel also has complimentary wine each evening from 5 - 7pm and we found this a great way to relax and meet other guests. Overall - would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasnt stay”
Reviews.Author: Loweprojects
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a two day stay on the way from London to Auckland. We had a generous and friendly welcome from the proprietor and his staff. After settling in, we joined him and other guests for a glass of wine before going we went out to dinner. We already felt warm towards the hotel, but the amenities, comfortable room and great location only served to confirm our willingness to recommend this hotel for anyone seeking a short stay on the west side of LA and near to BH, Hollywood and the beach resorts. There are none of the unwanted frills of the larger corporate hotels such as gyms and business centres, but the lobby PC is free for all, our rooms was plenty large enough and well appointed, and the personal touch for everyone connected with the hotel more are all that is needed for a 100% experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable but not great”
Reviews.Author: Otown_Adrian
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay however we found the room to be a bit small, bathroom counter space lacking and street noise louder than expected. Room was clean, nice balcony off room but without seating. Main lobby lounge area was sizeable and comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and staff was always available. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Still remembering our PHENOMENAL stay!”
Reviews.Author: gr8mom22
Reviews.Content: It's been almost a year since our stay at the Elan Hotel and my husband and I still talk about our time there. We had just debarked from a cruise and were headed to "Wicked" before we flew back home, so we wanted to be fairly close to the Pantages. We were greeted warmly and got settled in our room, only to find out we were immediately above the garage. When we mentioned that it was rather noisy, they immediately took care of it. We went out for the wine reception before we left for our show and it was delightful! The manager wasn't just sitting around, he was actively participating in making sure his guests were content. There was divine music playing as well - which turned out to be Sarah Brightman. :) Anyway - the evening was fantastic and when we checked out the next morning to head to the airport, they arranged for a special ride for us. The entire time there was memorable. The thing we appreciated the most was the intent personal touch. Finding people with a servant's heart these days is difficult...so we were absolutely thrilled!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmansfield
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Elan and as before, it was an enjoyable stay overall. It is far from the cheapest and the lack of pool probably doesn't help when there are hotels such as the Best Western Sunset Plaza nearby which have larger rooms and is cheaper. The staff though are an asset and are always helpful. One problem I do have, is the $19 + tax parking charge. Add to that a tip every time you get the car and it soon adds up. At the price they charge for a room, it would be nice if this were included.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: bigjaker_4
Reviews.Content: Could hear the rooms next door, talking, shower, and TV. But the Wine tasting in the evenings is great.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Gummie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at the Elan and the whole experience was second to none. Freshly renovated very tastefully and reception was the best we recieved in the US, nothing was too much trouble. The room was small, but the very large bed made up for that. Great location for access to the Beverley Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable--a good pick”
Reviews.Author: superh50
Reviews.Content: Hotel Elan had been renovated only a few weeks before I was there so the room amenities and decorations were new and really nice. The lobby and rooms are comfortable, and the bathrooms are nice with bath products and robes. The hotel is located very close to the Beverly Center so it's easy access to great shopping. Also, I really enjoyed the fresh continental breakfast and the free wine and cheese in the evenings. Definitely a good pick if you are in LA. I actually made a video while I stayed if you want to check out the room for yourself... http://www.tripfilms.com/Travel_Video-v64484-West_Hollywood-Where_to_Stay_in_LA_The_Elan_Hotel-Video.html

Reviews.Title: “Elan Hotel, 8435 BEVERLY BLVD , Los Angeles, CA”
Reviews.Author: zizoCairo
Reviews.Content: Elan Hotel, 8435 BEVERLY BLVD , Los Angeles, CA We just arrived from Cairo, Egypt May 10, 2008. The hotel is located in Beverly Hills, have access to Hospital, restaurants, Beverly Center Shopping Mall, etcâ€¦.It is a boutique hotel elegant and peaceful. We preferred to stay there than going out. We were greeted with a friendly staff, incredible service; we enjoyed the rooms and its fine linen, and amenities, I felt that I am at the Ritz Carlton. The continental breakfast is a lovely spread with fruit, pastries, tea, coffee, milk, muffins, bagels, cheese, newspaper, etcâ€¦ Afternoon wine and cheese is extraordinary and wonderful. The rate we paid is excellent and I would stay there every time I go to Los Angeles. I recommend this hotel highly. A. Salama

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!!! 'Cept the AC in the room.”
Reviews.Author: jagdog
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing from check-in to check-out. The renovations are almost complete, and I didn't hear them working on anything during our stay. The room was decent, kinda small but had everything we needed. Flat-screen tv, fridge, mini-bar, and a comfortable bed. The only problem was the AC didn't work in the room on record-high setting days. The hall-way was really cool and they were apologetic. Apparently they don't control the AC, some outside company does. Valet was fast, parking $19/day, and they have cheese and wine in the afternoons. Great hotel for access to the Beverly Center, although I do not get what the big deal is about that place. Even my wife who loves shopping was disappointed. There were 2 floors of shopping and 4 floors of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: franan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i arrived May 12. At check in they asked if we would mind having seperate rooms as the aircon in our booked twin room was faulty. We were delighted after spending too much time together over previous 2 weeks! Every staff member was friendly, efficient, thorough and very helpful this was our 15th hotel in 2 months travelling through Europe, Canada and the US. The rooms were immaculate, the location ideal for our needs and the complimentary breakfast and evening drinks in the lounge very welcome.The staff at Elan were a standout. We and our friends will be back.

Reviews.Title: “the negative reviews are incorrect”
Reviews.Author: bobzelin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elan Hotel this April, on the first floor, right next to the construction area. Until it was daytime during the week, you could not hear ANY noise in the room - it was silent. Even during construction, the rooms were immaculate, the staff was as nice as ever (I have stayed here for the past 6 years), and breakfast was bountiful and fresh. I know that there are homeless people living in other countries in nice areas on the street, so I was surprised to see the negative comments about the homeless people. This exists in "nice areas" in NY, Chicago, New Orleans, and every other major US City. As for "not worth the money" or "too expensive", I am not sure what discount website you are looking at for the West Hollywood area, but if you can find a wonderful hotel like Elan in West Hollywood for even close to their low rates, PLEASE let me know, as I search every year, and can't find anything close to their prices. The "nice hotel" down the block by the Beverly Center is about 3 times the price of the Elan. I am not aware of a better value in West Hollywood, than the Elan Hotel. Bob Zelin Orlando, FL.

Reviews.Title: “Elan hotel is great!”
Reviews.Author: xLillyx
Reviews.Content: I don't know why other users are complaining so much about this hotel. It is being renovated at the moment, but our stay was absolutely pleasant. The room is not big but it's ABSOLUTELY clean (they wash the sheets every day but you have the option to decide whether you prefer them being washed every 3 days to avoid wasting a lot of water). The bathroom is clean and nice; the air conditioning is slightly noisy but nothing so dramatic to disturb your sleep! I slept absolutely fine. Breakfast is complimentary; the breakfast hall is downstairs and you have a view of the street and the sun, which was very nice and mood-lifting (as if it need to be lifted anyway: we were in Los Angeles!! :) ) The staff is all very nice and they try to help you as they can, although admittedly they don't know much :). The housekeepers are always smiling and polite. Plus the hotel is in a very very good location, Sunset Boulevard is really close (we walked there one day) not to mention the Beverly Center shopping mall which is just 5 minutes away! As for the homeless people, unfortunately they are almost everywhere in LA. Not the hotel's fault. But the area is safe anyway. I would absolutely go back to the Elan!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sharpertravel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Elan from the Tripadvisor and found it to be a big disapointment. Its in need of a refurb. The ground floor rooms were being painted when we visited but the smell of paint went all through the hotel. Something was also wrong with the A/C on the first floor the rooms vibrated at certain times. The room was small by all standards and just not worth the money, its not cheap for a three star!!!! When we arrived if we had not pre booked we would have driven past its not a nice looking hotel and scruffy, plus and I know its not the hotels fault but two bums were sleeping in the next door way, which made the short walk to the Beverley centre unpleasant . Much nicer hotels at a cheaper price in the same area

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Elan”
Reviews.Author: Meathman
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 2 nights on a 3 week tour of Cali. Booked it on the recommendations of this site (Was no. 1 in LA at the time!) and having paid over the odds for a 3 star (?) hotel was very disappointed. While the location is great for shopping and touring Hollywood the hotel itself is cheap and shoddy. The air conditiioning is the noisiest i have ever experienced. When I couldn't turn mine off I tried everything from turning the vents up to taking out the circuit board and trying to stop it myself. I rang hotel services only to be told that once the AC was on in the next room I couldn't turn it off! I'm not a light sleeper and normalluy could put up with this but when its beside your bed you can't and the reaction of the staff didn't help. It ruined our stay and for that reason would never go back to it nor recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back to the Elan”
Reviews.Author: DP72
Reviews.Content: What a great find! I booked into the Elan because I couldn't find other accommodation in LA given it was the weekend of the academy awards. I'm really glad that I did. Staff were polite at check in and when I was checking out, the main couple of times I interacted with them. Bedroom faced onto a central courtyard and was fairly small, but adequate and with a definite boutique feel. The continental breakfast was just what was needed before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, currently being renovated”
Reviews.Author: A_Guy_in_Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business trip. As of February 10, 2008 the hotel was in the middle of construction to renovate it. The work is being done in a way that will not interfere with your stay. I would suggest calling the hotel directly to ask if the construction is finished. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms. Everything was quite comfortable. You can hear conversations in the next rooms but the noise level is not so bad. On one night there was a very loud party across the street (not at the hotel) that went until the early morning. The hotel of course is not responsible for that, and it seemed to be an exception (it only happened on one of the four nights we were there). Breakfast buffet is great. Staff is great. I couldn't make the wine and cheese from 5-7 pm but I imagine it is also quite nice. Good location for a hotel. We had a GPS in our car, which made it quite easy to explore San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Find”
Reviews.Author: ErnaSteve
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel stay imaginable. The hotel staff treats you like your in a five star resort. They doded on us from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. The valet parking staff were also amazing and ever so nice. When you arrive park in the front of the hotel in one of the green painted areas and a valet attendant will be out to assist you. We asked for a quiet room and they placed us in a room near the back of the hotel but in this court type of area. The room was not huge but totally sufficient and had a King Bed and a decorator's touch. The bathroom was amazing and had a granite counter. The air conditioning worked great as well. Every night the hotel had a wine and cheese from 5-7 p.m. What an added bonus this was. The breakfast was also plentiful and again their staff doded on us every morning. Every day the desk staff provided us with mapquest directions to our next destination and upon our return took the time to ask us about our day. The hotel is older but because of how well its decorated and kept up you would never know it. We paid $189.00 CAA rate plus parking and taxes and it was one of the best deals in the city for the quality of room and service we received. Both my husband and I would return and if your as fussy as I am about the way a room looks then this is the hotel for you - The room had a designer's touch which made it enjoyable to return each night. The Hotel is also about a block away from the Beverly Centre which we walked to no problem. Do yourself a favour though and rent a car. There is only so much you can do by foot or by taxi. To truly enjoy LA rent a car and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Meyta
Reviews.Content: This little property makes you feel at home. Their expanded continental breakfast is stocked with very high quality food items and yummy coffee. Elan is just two blocks from Beverly Center and surrounded by lovely dining options and beautiful houses. Just down the road you can visit NBC Studios or the Farmer's Market. Bedding is of good quality with a home feel, I really enjoyed their standard turndown of hershey kisses and a handwritten note with the weather. Valet parking is super efficient and incredible polite

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTravelers
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel - tucked away in West Hollywood, you can not find a better place in LA! I stayed here for business, and found the staff to be extremely attentive, friendly, and helpful. The rooms are nicely appointed and well taken care of. Complimentary high-speed (wireless) internet throughout the hotel is a +++. Breakfast in the morning is great, complimentary wine and cheese in the evening is a perfect way to come home from a long day at work. The place is small enough to feel like home, but large enough to offer and compete with the "big-dogs" in the LA hotel industry. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: FaXi73
Reviews.Content: Great comfortable clean room, lovely presentation of toiletteries. Bit dark because on the first floor, fantastic lactation, friendly staff, great breakfast served in nice lounge area Very dated fitness room, would not recommend using the equipment!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: puppetshow
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with friendly staff. Rooms small, but well-appointed with a boutique feel. Good continental breakfast and complementary evening happy hour was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: wisborough
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Elan for 4 nights in September.It is a good and very friendly hotel with the most comfortable beds/linen we have ever encountered in such a reasonably priced hotel.The staff were universally friendly and helpful.The only major failing was the breakfast which was a bit hit or miss and eaten rather uncomfortably in the lobby with LA traffic streaming by just a window width away. If you need to be in this part of LA then we would reccomend the Elan without hesitation,and the walking distance to great shopping and eating has its advantages.However this part of LA is not the most attractive and with hindsight we would as tourists,stay in Santa Monica and do our tours/shopping from there.

Reviews.Title: “Such friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Deebee7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in september. The room was a king & it was spacious enough. The staff however makes this hotel so good. They are incredably friendly! I forgot something in my room & they shipped it to another hotel for me (ok it dit not arrive but it wasn't really their fault). Efficient valet service (bit pricey though). Nice croissants at breakfast (being european we appreciated this after a week of muffins & bagels) In a whole: really nice hotel. Room was nice, staff so friendly & nice breakfast. Maybe just one minor glitch: the aircovents in our room did not close completely & we couldn't find where we could switch it off (don't think you could). So it was a cold & drafty night.

Reviews.Title: “Expedia gives a horrible description of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: inthefashionbiz
Reviews.Content: Hi There: I stayed at this hotel on a split trip for business and pleasure over the summer and was rudely suprised by the physical location of the place based on what I saw on Expedia. Although the hotel is smack dab in the heart of LA just down the street from the Beverly Center. It is FAR from Modern and for what I paid a night almost $200 a night it still gives me a burn in my belly just thinking about it. Not to mention, there is absolutely no parking around the hotel so they force you to valet. The hotel looks like its straight out of a 1960's movie in desperate need of renovation. The room was a matchbox and very nasty. We sleep in all of our clothes the first night because we could not adjust the AC and the street stunk. The bathtub was dirty and the sink was stopped up. When we requested another room the staff told us that they were completely soldout all week. Expedia wouldnt give us our money back and told us that we were on our own if we wanted to go elsewhere. The only thing that saves this hotel from me giving it complete "TERRIBLE" rating is that the manager and staff were extremely apologetic and accomodating understanding our concerns. We ended up getting back like $200 off the stay and some credits from Expedia after about an 1hr 30 min wait on hold. Nonetheless, Joel Majors and the entire staff at Elan Hotel Modern were very nice. I hope that the owners read this review and invest into upgrading the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again. Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mlbc
Reviews.Content: We had read the great reviews and not knowing where to stay in LA, we thought we'd book the Elan. We are so glad we did. I loved the hotel. The staff were fantastic, it was convenient to the Beverly Centre and not too long a walk to the Farmers Market. We were also able to get the 25 cent bus at the end of the road to Hollywood Blvd. We were impressed with our lovely room, the bathrobe, toiletries and the breakfast was an added bonus. There was everything you could need for breakfast (as my husband and I don't do greasy food) and you could have as much as you wanted. Although we were never there for the wine reception, it was great to know that it was available. The staff really couldn't have been more helpful as we needed 25 cent for the bus one day and they were going to give it to us. There was a little conufsion on our return home as our credit card had been billed a nominal amount but I contacted the hotel and it was refunded immediately. I really couldn't recommend this hotel enough. I have to say, the views didn't bother me at all - I'd much rather have a great standard of hotel. After all, how much of your time do you actually spend in the hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: dnbrownmd
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week in Los Angeles at the Elan. It is very conveniently located about a block from the Beverly Center. It is proximate to all the tourist sites we were interested in visiting. Customer service was top notch - very friendly and accommodating. There is a decent breakfast every morning. (Great - strong - coffee and croissants) included in the cost of the stay. Parking is valet and costs 19 dollars per day though the site said 16 dollars per day. There is metered parking adjacent to the hotel. We decided to forego the valet parking and just fed the meters during the times they were monitored (8 am to 6 pm, M-F). The rooms were clean. The bed was very comfortable and the sheets were great. Rooms are a little on the small side. The building is a bit old and it shows. She's like an old gal with fresh make up. Overall, this is a solid hotel and we had a comfortable week stay with a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jessib
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor and we were not dissapointed. The room was big and had a great tv and there were sweets on a table and chocolate on the bed every day. The only bad thing was that there were no chairs on the balcony but who cares. Good location, great staff, good valetparking and good breakfast. I would definetly live there again and i would recomend everyone to do so to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: meshu24
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was definately the best part of our stay. When we arrived, there was a misunderstanding about the days & events we were booked for. The staff took it upon themselves to correct the situation, and actually gave us tickets to the modern art museum as an apology. At a large hiotel, you would almost never get that kind of personal attention. The room was clean, but the walls are very thin, and I could hear the television next door - not a really big deal though since we were gone most of the day. The continental breakfast is good, and the "diner" across the street where you order room service from is GREAT!! It is definately the most affordable food in L.A. and the hotel staff even puts it on a tray with real silverware (not plastic) and brings it up to you. The portions are huge too - enough to share. The only negative was that there is only valet parking, and since the hotel is on a busy street, you need to pull up right in front of the hotel, so sometimes we had to go around the block. We will definately go back to the Elan!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice but not posh”
Reviews.Author: Rfangirl
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice but not posh Pros Location, nice staff, valet, clean rooms, good bath products. Cons Loud elevator, overlooked goodwill donation and taco bell. Full Review The Elan Modern is a nice hotel, not as posh as the photos may make it seem. It is a good deal for the location 2 blocks from the Beverly Center. No swimming pool, bar or restaurant, although you can order from diner across the street. We drove to the Farmers Market for meals a few times. Bfast buffet not too exciting, cereal, bagels, juice. The staff was nice, the valet service very fast. We did have to move our room - it got very hot on 2 afternoons so they moved us. There are only 2 floors so it is nice to get in and out to your room. The elevator made a lot of noise. We drove to several studios, up Mullholland, to Hollywood Blvd, and for our four days everything was pretty close. If you want a very high end LA experience, this isn't your hotel. But a good value, clean room and nice staff makes me recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try.............”
Reviews.Author: rdy2g0
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed here from Aug. 4 - 9, and thought it was a very nice hotel and we felt quite safe in the neighborhood. Didn't want to pay fancy hotel prices because we figured we wouldn't be sitting in a hotel all day. Yes, there are homeless but they do not bother you at all. We walked around alot and it is a very convenient location. Would definitely stay here again. We didn't want to rent a car, so we took the metro bus to a few places (1.25), the dash bus, (.25) and the subway to Universal Studios (1.50). Very easy to get around and a great starting point. Room 216 was very quiet and friendly room staff. Breakfast was good & fresh every morning. Wine & cheese a good snack. The one negative was the Wolfgang Puck coffee they serve. Worst coffee I have ever tasted. Also, room key card kept getting disconnected. But, over all, good value.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem of a hotel! Please never chane”
Reviews.Author: MissElainey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic 4 night stay at the Elan in Los Angeles. Yes it is a former retirement home, yes it does look out on a diner (which does a great omlet, and is full of charm) a goodwill and a Taco Bell. But if that's the worst thing it ain't so bad. The staff are terriffic, they can't do enough for you. We arrived early for check in and no problem. The wine and cheese hours basically can go on until the bottles are finished. The rooms are compact but clean well maintained and quiet. And they have fabulous pillows and excellent quality bed sheets!! There is a fast internet connection in the business center. There are several excellent resaurants nearby Pastis a gorgeous french bistro just 5 min up the road. I was told by one of the staff members the hotel has just been bought, I hope they will not change the winning formula of the Elan Modern. They are number one, the way things are done now is obviously working for them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...Nice...Nice...We'll Return...”
Reviews.Author: itsmemick
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we listened to all the wonderful reviews. Yes...a 2 story hotel can be very nice...we had our doubts... Imaculate...extra friendly helpful employees...wine hours...breakfast...and a great price and location. Don't forget to visit the "diner" across the street...certainly not a typical diner...Bloomies...P.F.Chengs Chinese a block away...a BIG mall with everything...a wonderful unexpected wonderful location. We WILL be back...we are so glad we listened to the desk clerk recommendation our last night there...a TERRIFIC romatic (in the rear garden) Italian restaurant....just terrific...a few tables away was Billy D. Williams...if you remember the name...this was our last stop on a San Francisco to L.A. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good but.....”
Reviews.Author: davcat
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited about staying at the Elan after reading the reviews here and overall our stay was good. The room was lovely, clean and very well equipped for our needs. The staff are very good and were quite informative. Really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, more than sufficient for a day's siteseeing. The cheese/wine in the evenings was also very good, nice touches. However, we did leave a little disappointed. After our arrival, one of the Desk Clerks asked us had we plans to attend a show while in LA, he recommeded either Jersey Boys or Wicked, we opted for Jersey Boys as it's not due in Europe until 2008. He said he could get tickets for $115 which we thought was quite alot but he assured us they were good tickets, so we went ahead. With booking fee etc. the total at $245. When we got to the theatre we were very upset to see our $115 tickets actually had a face value of $60 so we paid $110 over the odds (not something we would never, ever do), we felt quite "done". Taxis each way were $40 plus tips so overall an expensive night. We edmention it to the desk clerk when we returned that evening and he did apologise, however, they should tell guests they are booking with an agent and that the tickets will be inflated in price in future. It made us wonder whether the hotel have a deal going with the booking agent......... So be warned, book your own tickets or check the face value of the tickets before you buy. The above dosen't take from the cleanliness etc of the hotel, as for location, it's as good as any especially when you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Service is why there are so many great reviews.”
Reviews.Author: EPH04
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Elan Modern, it's very easy to see why the hotel's reviews are so high. What sets this property apart from so many other hotels is the amazing service of its staff. Few places I have stayed have rivaled the front desk/concierge service of the Elan. (Note: The Elan doesn't really have room service; they can provide it from the diner across the street.) The Elan's front desk/concierge staff's service easily reminded me of several Four Seasons. During my stay, the front desk/concierge staff went above and beyond to provide information and directions about local sights and restaurants. They volunteered to print out personalized driving directions and explained how to (try to) avoid the LA rush hour. Most amazing, however, was after checking out and getting directions to the airport, the one of the front desk/concierge staff gave me his business card and said to please call the hotel if I got lost, stuck in traffic, or needed further assistance on my way. Few hotels care enough about their guests to offer to assist them after they have left and paid their bill. Our room (111) was small, but nice and clean. As it was below street level, it had no view whatsoever, but overall we were pretty happy with it. The worst part about the Elan is that the neighborhood isn't that great. Across the street is a Taco Bell and a Goodwill store and next door to the hotel is a car tire shop. Excluding the massive Beverly Center mall a few blocks away, there really aren't any good restaurants, coffee shops, or anything else of interest nearby the hotel. Fortunately, however, the sights of Beverly Hills, Melrose, Hollywood, and other, better LA neighborhoods aren't too far away (relatively speaking). If the Elan was only in a better neighborhood, it would be a perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great!”
Reviews.Author: scaper4782
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Elan Modern Hotel based on the reviews from the tripadvisor. I was extending my conference-stay in L.A. for a couple of days and staying on my own, wanted a good and safe hotel. I booked via booking.com and bought also a 3-day Go LA Card - pays you back twice if you want to see the main touristic attractions and do not have many days for that. When I arrived at the hotel, it was nice and very clean, staff very pleasant. Walking through the corridor I was asking myself why this hotel was rated nr.1 in such a city as L.A. There was nothing wrong, but I was not so much impressed. But then after the porter, who was helping me with my suitcase closed the door, I found myself in a spotlessly elegant room, where every detail was though of! The AC was perfect, fridge full of soft drinks and also some wine and beer, big TV with up to 20 channels plus a VCR, plus a choice of some very good films to get from the reception. For a woman a provided good iron was a must. Great bathroom with a bath-tube, nice toiletries, a bathrobe, thick towels of all sizes. Every evening when I came to the room, a small lamp was on, a few chocolate bonbons with a wish of a good sleep and a weather forecast for the next day on the bed, that was a very nice homely touch. WiFi was included in the price of the room. Breakfast was very good although basic - yoghurt, cereals, fresh bagels, marmalade, boiled eggs, great coffee, some fruits. The concierge was truly amiable and helpful every day with my questions about "the best way to get there and there..", they were absolutely amazing. The hotel is very close to the shopping mall - Beverly Center. The area is ok, safe. It is in West Hollywood. Overall I had a perfect stay in the Elan Hotel, for three stars is is exceptional. I would advise it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay With Very Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: The_hodge
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Elan hotel with my girlfried at the end of April 07, based on the reviews on trip advisor. The location of the hotel is good (not too far from either Beverly Hills or Hollywood - though I wouldn't recommend walking), the staff are some of the best (if not the best) I've come across and the room was a decent size. It also had nice little touches like leaving chocolates on your pillow and putting classical music on after your room had been cleaned. However, the hotel perhaps isn't quite as great as some people seem to be making out and isn't too special. For example, it doesn't have a resturant and the food they can order for you (from the cafe over the road) leaves something to be desired. Overall though a good stay and somewhere I would certainly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Close to The Grove, but not the best choice for American Girl Place visitors”
Reviews.Author: momonthegoe
Reviews.Content: My 9-year old daughter and I recently stayed at The Elan for a special trip for her to visit American Girl Place at The Grove mall in LA. The location couldn't have been better, but the walls in this hotel are paper thin...the late night conversations of our neighbors may as well have been ours, too. Our first-floor room had a sliding glass door to an alley, and made me a little unconfortable when i could hear outside conversations. The staff is very friendly, the breakfast is nice, the rooms were clean and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this rated so well?”
Reviews.Author: Mills05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights recently. The staff was friendly,,.but there were only 3 people working..a front desk person, a valet ($16 a day) and a cleaning person. After reading the reviews on here, I had expected much more. This "hotel" is basically a small older motel that has been smartly interior designed to be "hip". Our room was poorly ventilated, stuffy and smelled like paint. It was described as a "king" but only had a Full-sized bed in it. The hotel itself is located across the street from a Taco Bell and a Salvation Army...hardly the "Beverly Hills" experience. It also did not have a pool, a bar or any of the other upscale ammenities you'd expect in this area. Stay at the Roosevelt or the Sunset Tower instead for a real L.A. experience. They have the palm trees, staff, pools, bars, and the views that you'd expect for this price range in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: greenwoodkody
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elan the weekend of June 8-9, 2007. My employer usually uses Le Meridien, which is around the corner on La Cienega, but it closed on the 9th for a long renovation. Sofitel just up the street was too expensive. The Elan lived up to the promises made on its Web site. It is a clean, simple, small property in a fabulous location. I walked to WeHo nightlife, breakfast and shopping on 3rd Street, dinner, and shopping at the Beverly Center. In fact, I valet parked my car at 5 p.m. on Friday and had no need to drive again until 2 p.m. on Saturday---very unusual for L.A.! I stayed in room 209 which is on the street side, southwest corner. I recommend the room unless you are super-sensitive to street noise, as it had its own private balcony. Views weren't great, but from one corner of the balcony I could see the Hollywood Hills. Directly across the street was a Taco Bell and a Goodwill Store; to the west, Macy's and Bloomingdale's were so close, you could practically throw a baseball and hit the side of their building. Room itself was fairly spare but had everything one would need, and it was very clean. Modern, well-appointed, nice carpeting, good furniture, good bed, nice linens, and a clean bathroom with good quality soaps and shampoos. Honor bar. FREE wireless internet. Yes, FREE. You don't get that in the fancy places! I got a rate of $169/night through my corporate travel agent, which beat the hotel's own Web site by $20/night. Valet parking was $16/night, which isn't cheap but not bad, really. There are nearby meters and when I did use my car, I sometimes parked at a meter rather than go through the whole valet drop-off procedure. Not to worry, though: when you call for your car, it's usually curbside within three minutes; the garage is under the building. There aren't many amenties on-site, but, really, who cares? You can walk to shopping, restaurants, nightlife, etc. There's a very small fitness center with 3 or 4 treadmills and stair machines. But it's L.A., for goodness sake, so if you want to go running, you just hit the streets. (Actually, I recommend visiting Runyon Canyon Park for a fun hike/run and incredible views of the L.A. city basin; about a 10 or 15 minute drive from the hotel.) Room rate includes continental breakfast in the lobby. This was really quite decent: cereals, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee/tea. What more do you need? Plenty of tables and seating areas, with views onto Beverly Blvd., where you can eat. Also some seating on patio. There is a small "business center" room with a computer and printer, where I printed out my boarding pass for flight home, plus a small conference table. Nothing fancy, but if you needed to have a little business meeting with a few associates, it would be fine. Staff were uniformly pleasant, cheerful, helpful, from the valet/doorman guy to the desk clerk to the maids. No complaints there. One thing I was puzzled about was what the views are from the rooms that are on the inner corridor. As I mentioned, I was in a room on the exterior of the building, on a corner, but the hallway went in a full rectangle, so the inner rooms must look out onto some sort of courtyard or something. I would ask for a room onto the back alley or onto the street, myself. Again, I highly recommend room 209, as it's a corner room with balcony. So often you book a room at a hotel that looks kinda cool on the Web site, and then you get there only to have your expectations not met and your hopes dashed. The Elan was a pleasant surprise. Keep your expectations realistic (this ain't the Four Seasons, folks), and you'll be happy. Need nightlife? Lots nearby, and apparently the bar at the aforementioned Sofitel, a 3-minute walk, has quite the scene.

Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: WYJetlag
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 2 night stay at the Elan. Room was nice (love the balcony). The important part for me was the service. They had a list of recommended restaurants (mapped out would have been great), which is always nice. In addition, I accidentally left something at the hotel. After contacting the manager, he shipped it to me that day, and it arrived the next. Terrific service!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a stopover in LA”
Reviews.Author: glynnhesel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in April 2007 en route home from Hawaii. We found the rooms reasonably spacious, very clean and well equipped including free use of room safe. We did experience some room to room noise transmission but it was not obtrusive (I guess neighbours in hotels are the luck of the draw!). The lobby/ breakfast area is in need of some refurbishment and was in the process of being painted during our stay. We found the location very good as we wanted to do some shopping. The Beverly Centre (5 mins) and The Grove Centre (20 mins) walk away provided a good cross section of stores. There is also a Farmers Market near the Grove Centre which is a great (and inexpensive) place for lunch. The staff at the Hotel were very friendly and helpful and the internet access was most useful for checking in online for our flight home. We would stay here again when transiting through Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: CorySGFA
Reviews.Content: Definitely a place to visit. Los Angeles has many hotels and it is difficult to find a good choice. If you are looking to have some fun and stay at a nice stylish hotel, then this is the place to be. Make sure you book one of the rooms in the higher floors since they tend to be less loud than the lower floor ones. Also, there is a great cafe around the corner called Delouge in which the Hotel Staff can get you great reservations. Finally, the bar scene is to die for. Definitely LA's best are found here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but number 1?”
Reviews.Author: missminivan
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for 2 nights whilst in transit to Canada for a ski holiday based on reviews here. Whilst I agree that it is good value for money compared to other hotels in the area, I am a little suprised that it still rates up there at No 1. I guess this is probably more of a value rating than anything else . The room we had the first night we arrived was unfortunately right next to the foyer/breakfast area and after a long flight from Sydney we were a bit annoyed at the noisey clatter outside our door from 5.30 in the morning. Having said this we did request to be moved the following night and this was done with absolutely no fuss at all. As all other travellers have said the staff are great, the rooms are clean and relatively spacious and the location is pretty good. The complimentary drinks at night is a lovely gesture but I can't vouch for the breakfast as we cose to dine at the nearby farmers markets.This is a great hotel if you are just looking for somewhere to rest the head but does not offer much else in the way of facilities if you want to hang out at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: ncalad
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in an idean spot. The rooms are tastefully decorated and clean. I've stayed here a half dozen times now. There is a nice continental breakfast every morning too. I definitely recommend the Elan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mellybelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend in March and we both loved it. Unbeatable in LA for the price. Very nice room, helpful staff, perfect location. We enjoyed the breakfast and wine and cheese very much. The front desk staff was so helpful. We also loved the free internet access in the business center, since most hotels charge for this or do not have it easily accessible. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Alas, wine no longer served at the wine&cheese reception”
Reviews.Author: MaryfromBoston
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the earlier reviews, wine wasn't served at the late afternoon reception. For breakfast, the almond croissants and blueberry muffins are terrific. Alas, no cream cheese or butter for the bagels. There's only one computer in the "business center" so you may have to wait .. but it's free. Was able to street-park at low cost on Croft Street (the hotel is on the corner of Croft) -- two-hour meters from 8 AM to 6 PM for $2/2hours, free overnight. Room was decent - I asked for a quiet room and it was. Had a tiny (too narrow for a chair) balcony over-looking an interior courtyard and other balconies/rooms - not very appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Bontaks
Reviews.Content: Completely agree with previous review. Staff were amazing and couldn't do enough for you. The breakfast was perfect for those not interested in the full on bacon and eggs deal - lots of cereal choices, bagels, pastries, juice, coffee, fruit, different breads, boiled eggs, yogurt... Plenty really. Comfortable beds. Good location for a lot of central things. Would recommend hiring a car - we didn't, expecting to rely on public transport and wasted money on cabs. Will know better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location...Bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: Valerie1965
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. Free wine and cheese in the evening is a real bonus! We drank our wine and some comfy chairs looking out the huge glass windows. This hotel is on a busy street. The walls are thin...so bring ear plugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff, Staff, Staff”
Reviews.Author: pnmdotcom
Reviews.Content: Staff, staff, staff is what this hotel is all about. Can't praise them highly enough. Very friendly and efficient, anything you need they will get. Room was very clean and spacious, but the queen bed did feel rather small and cramped. Nice location for restaurants, farmer's market, Grove centre and the usual touristy things associated with Hollywood and Beverly Hills. Nice touch with the cheese and wine in the evening whilst watching the world pass by on Beverly Boulevard. Continental breakfast ample for a good, healthy start to the day. Understand that later in the year some of the facilities will be upgraded, including the provision of flat screen TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: edmund44
Reviews.Content: A great find, centrally located, with some key perks. The daily continental breakfast is ample, and served in a comfy, well-lit main lobby with great windows on Beverly Blvd. An even better perk is the afternoon wine and cheese. The vintages aren't fantastic, but it's a refreshing, relaxing treat after a day at the beach and such. The rooms are small but clean and well maintained. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: worthington
Reviews.Content: The Elan is a great little hotel. We chose the Elan for our four-night stay based on Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The rooms are modern and comfortable, the staff is great, and the complimentary breakfast is more than adequate. The location is within walking distance to the Beverly Center (mall) and good restaurants (including Koi). I wish every city I visited had a comparable property that was as well-priced and welcoming as the Elan!

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing for Busy City”
Reviews.Author: funshine2
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door we were greeted with warm enthusiam. It is an older hotel but very modern. The colors, and fixtures and linens, carpet, were all new and extremely clean. I have stayed at some Sheratons and Hyatts that may have some mold around the tiles/shower, (pet pieve) but not a speck to be found here!!! They have floor to ceiling windows in a spacious lobby with several cozy chairs where you can enjoy the nice continnental breakfast or especially the complimentary wine and cheese, crackers, pretzels, nuts at 5:00 p.m. all while the jazz music and the outside nighttime lights of Beverly Blvd. slows you down and rejuvenates you before going out. The hotel staff are quite knowledgable about the area and are eager to assist with directions and recommendations. They were happy people and it was a pleasure staying there. Also it is an excellant central location for so many attractions. We went to a play at the Pantages and shopping at various areas and Santa Monica and more and all were not far. Definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best .....”
Reviews.Author: matt_hosk
Reviews.Content: So you're booking a trip through the internet? Suffering from information overload? Relax....your hotel in L.A. is sorted. The Elan Hotel Modern is unique. Most importantly, it's outstanding value for money. Comfortable bedrooms with great touches like a turn down service where they leave you chocolates and switch on your radio to classical music. A better than adaquate continental breakfast. The most efficient valet parking in the world [well, my world anyway!]. And a great front desk [I booked an alarm call one morning, on returning late at night, they remembered and asked if I wanted to rebook for the following morning]. There is useful information about sight seeing and restaurants in the rooms. The weekday evening cheese and wine is great, as is the computer with free internet access. There is a diner across the road, a 24 hour drug store and plenty of restaurants a short distance away. We felt very safe walking. Los Angeles is a large sprawling impersonal city. Come home each evening to a welcoming, friendly and well run oasis. Come home to the Elan Hotel Modern.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel bargain”
Reviews.Author: MissChrisCentralPA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Elan about 6 times during the last 2 years. Our daughter lives in the area and we have experimented with other properties close by (Sofitel and LeMeridien). When we found the Elan, we stayed with it! We like that it is NOT a chain. The service people are friendly and the ambience is a bit different from other places. It is small (about 50 rooms) and only two floors, consequently, no lines for elevators or to access our car. A straight shot from the airport (on LaCienega) it is convenient to get to and to get around to Beverly Hills, Hollywood, Miracle Mile, etc., without getting on an freeway. There is a convenient buffet breakfast and access to the internet. I do not think this place is for heavy-duty business travelers nor does it seem to attract them. For those of us who are there for vacation, it's nice not to have those work-type intrusions. My one criticism is that some of the rooms are looking a bit tired. I have heard that a refurbishing is planned, so you may want to check on that. I just came on the website to check about the Orlando which is another boutique hotel in the same area; however, given the cost of that hotel (~$100 more per night) and the guest reactions, I am staying with the Elan.

Reviews.Title: “good location, clean and friendly personnel”
Reviews.Author: huguetje
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in the hotel. First in December on our way to Argentina and then returning from Argentina in january. The rooms were clean and good size. The location is wonderful. I can recommend a very good Italian restaurant in Beverly Hills which is Da Pasquale and not so far from the hotel. I can also recommend to ask the hotel to make a reservation for a rent-a-car when you arrive in the airport. It is much cheaper than a taxi ! We paid only 53 dollar for 1 day. Service was perfect. I only would love to see the breakfast a little extensive. The internet service is perfect and for free. A place to go back when we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bewoodsy
Reviews.Content: On first impression this hotel looks like a store, it has large windows that look directly onto the four lane road and as it blends into the other buildings in the area it is easily missed. Once inside you have an impression of a retro hotel of the 60's where the one main room doubles for a lounge/breakfast/buffet area. My one complaint regarding this room is that it has no blinds. This causes a problem in the morning when the sun shines directly into your eyes while you eat breakfast. In the evening when they serve a brilliant free cheese and wine buffet you can still be viewed from the road. I found it a little too open for comfort.......consider blinds please! We stayed there on two separate occassions, both times the rooms were clean and tidy, although if you are allocated room number 229 try not to sleep in the bed near the window, as the air condition via the vent is directed to the head. I had to sleep with a towel on my head to prevent it from freezing. (I did try to alter the airconditioning but it then became too hot). The situation of this hotel is magnificent, it is in the centre of all the tourist haunts, and the hotel will arrange trips for you on request. The General Manager Leon was brilliant and along with the other staff made our trip much more pleasurable. I would definately recommed this hotel to other tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Here are the special advantages of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: boomertraveller
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, We stayed at the Elan for four nights early in January 2007, and for three nights in mid-December 2006. In between these stays, we were holidaying in other US locations. We were visiting the US for a vacation and are Australians. We've been to LA several times before so sightseeing in LA was not a priority. Rather, relaxing and having fun in Beverly Hills was our objective. This hotel was therefore located well for us, being very close to the Beverly Center mall and close to the "hip" shopping streets of Beverly Hills - eg, Robertson Boulevard, and Melrose. A downside to the location is that Beverly Boulevard (in the direction away from the Beverly Center) is sometimes a little seedy: There were some suspicious characters hanging around in the street but they did not appear dangerous (but what do I know?). There are plenty of good restaurants nearby. However, our favourite restaurant is, in fact, a diner (!!) right opposite the Elan. It is called Jan's coffee house. It has wonderful food and if you use Google you will find out quickly that it is a traditional US diner. The customers are locals and either baby boomers or older seniors. It is popular and noisy but in a fun way. The Elan delivers meals from Jan's if you request room service. A menu from Jan's is in each room. We didn't take great advantage of the free Elan morning buffet (which was fine) as we liked the bigger breakfasts (many types of omelettes and other all day breakfast dishes) and coffee (which some on the internet rate as LA's best coffee!) at Jan's. However, my husband brought up coffee and fruit juice from the buffet to get us started, first thing each morning. At the end of each day, the complimentary wine and cheese was a great wind down / wind up. The usual idiot talking loudly on his cell phone to all his great clients threatened to spoil one such occasion. What can you do? These idiots are everywhere nowadays (sigh). The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and comfortable, and all the electrical appliances worked well. Daily room service was unobtrusive and meticulous. Beds were comfy. Airconditioning was a little temperamental, but that may have been our lack of skill. The elevator was satisfactory but could use a clean. (If staff are reading this, I am sure they will immediately clean it!) We had a small balcony outside our room. We liked our room overlooking Beverly Boulevard as you feel part of the city and it really comes alive at dawn with traffic. (You can request a quieter room not overlooking the boulevard if you prefer. ) What sets this hotel apart from others, however, is the superior service provided at the front desk. Eg: Every time we came close to entering the front glass doors, a man ran to open them for us and greeted us with a friendly smile. The staff were genuinely interested in where we were from, what we planned to do for the day, and any particular requests we had. Yet they did not once become nosy. They know exactly where to draw the line. Also, every complaint we made (and yes, we did have a few minor ones such as asking for a tradesman to stop cleaning a carpet in a nearby room with a noisy machine while we were in our room) was answered with an apology and immediate attention and resolution of our complaint. Eg: When we rejected a Beverly Hills cab that they had called because a horribly scruffy, dirty looking man alighted from the taxi (he was the driver!!!) they called us another cab immediately and apologised. They did not criticise us for not caring about a scruffy cab driver or refusing to accept the cab. When the scruffy cab driver came into the lobby to ask where the passengers were, I heard the desk clerk say, "They (meaning us) changed their mind". He was pretty smooth! On our second stay in January we rented a car at the airport and the valet parking was perfect. We tipped every now and again and when we didn't tip (due to rushing) the man was still just as nice to us. The man who carried our bags to our room on arrival and from our room on departure was quick and attentive, and competent. Our bed was turned down each evening and the radio was on playing soothing music. There were small chocolates left on the bed for us each evening and a printed note relaying the next day's weather forecast. I had my laptop with me and so used the free wifi access which worked well. There was other internet access available for guests. The front desk staff will go to any lengths to help the guests with requests or complaints. The staff seem to really enjoy being in the hospitality game. Both my husband and I recommend this place highly for the superior front desk service and great location! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Vic888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights based on reviews on our vaction from singapore, and 1st impression was how friendly the check in staff were. Rooms are small but clean and buffet for breakfast was ok. The location is great and its easy to get anywhere around LA from here if you have a car. The free wine and chees every evening is a nice touch. negatives would be the lack of blinds to stop the sun literally blinding you in breakfast area, and prices are high at $150ish/night compared to other 3 star hotels like Holiday Inn express ..especially ig like us you just want a place to sleep. Overall a nice hotel with very freindly and helpful staff .

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, helpful staff and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: lessmore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here once in early December, '06 and again in early January, '07. Both times were great experiences and we'll not hesitate to go back again. The location is within walking distance of many excellent restaurants and shopping. A short drive will take you to the heart of Beverly Hills and all it's hot spots for shopping, dining and nightlife. I have to say that we've stayed in some of the world's finest hotels and the staff here at Elan was every bit as helpful, friendly and courteous as any five-star hotel we've visited. The property is in an older remodeled building. The rooms are cozy with contemporary fixtures throughout. But, this is not the hotel to choose if your plans are to cocoon yourself in your room. The rooms are neat and clean, but small. This is the hotel to choose if you are planning on getting out to see L. A. and all it has to offer. The nightly wine reception in the lobby is a great way to wrap a day of touring, business, and/or shopping. And, t's also a great way to kick off a night "on the town." This has to be one of Hollywood's best kept secrets. We love it and, as I mentioned above, we'll be back! We owe a great big 'thank you" to the extremely cordial staff at Elan!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Rach212
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a fairly inexpensive but decent place to stay in LA for 4 days. After reading loads of reviews about crabby and skanky hotels in LA, I was at a wits end until I chanced upon the reviews of Hotel Elan on Tripadvisor. Based on the raving reviews, we booked 3 rooms in Oct and were totally glad we trusted Tripadvisor.com once again! The Hotel Elan is a shining beacon in a sea of really expensive hotels and really crabby motels in LA. It may be a "higher-end" budget place or as some term it a "boutique" hotel, however what sealed our wonderful experience here was really the staff at reception. Practically everyone at reception was super helpful, friendly and took obvious pride in their work. They took pains to ask us each day where we intended to go, and unprompted, printed driving maps for us and gave us very clear directions - really helpful for us as we were used to driving on the other side of the road! We felt really welcome here and got great advice from the staff about places to go, restaurants and night spots. The rooms are nicely appointed, although on the small side. And as this used to be an old folk's home before it was given new life as a hotel, the hallways still retain an "old folks home" feeling. We had 3 rooms - 2 were small and faced the inner courtyard, 1 was at the end of the corridor and was distinctly larger. If you prefer more space for your rooms, ask for the rooms at the end of the corridors. The location was convenient as well, close to Sunset and Santa Monica Blvds, and it was easy getting to the major freeways. I loved the fact that I could walk to Beverly Center shopping mall, which was useful since I had a free day by myself whilst my friends went to Magic Mountain. I spent an entire day at the mall and walked back by myself after dark - it was quite safe. The free continental breakfast that comes with the room was more than adequate. The lobby area does get quite crowded during peak breakfast time, and like another reviewer pointed out, it gets really hot with the sun streaming in. We tried to get back in time for the free wine reception but alas, the sights of LA beckoned and we never did made it in time. Was a nice thought though. Overnight parking for our car was $14 in an underground garage - it was great to have a valet park it and bring it around in the morning. On our second day, the guy at reception recognised us and before we could request for our car, it was driven out whilst we were having breakfast - great service! Overall, we loved the Hotel Elan! I was especially relieved as I was i/c of booking the hotel for our party of 6. Thanks once again TripAdvisor! I never leave home anymore without checking out the reviews here!

Reviews.Title: “This place is the business !”
Reviews.Author: cquinn
Reviews.Content: Ok - this hotel is very good. Pro's: Good location: Near a big shopping mall. With plenty of taxis right outside. Very near to beverly hills - and a fantastic restaurant called fogoa de choi (brazillian steakhouse). Staff: They are very nice and always willing to help. Freebies: The breakfast is very good. Juice and tea/coffee. Cereals and loads of different pastries and fruits. The free red and white wine every night and this is nice wine by the way. Room: Medium sized room - spotlessly clean and cleaned daily. And a good shower. Internet - Free wireless access and also a free desktop internet connection too. Cons - I really cant think of any. Ok there is no swimming pool but what do you expect from a very fairly priced hotel. How can people not say that this is a great place to stay. Its just ideal. I used tripadvisor to book the whole lot of my 4 week honeymoon and i guarantee anyone that they will have a pleasant stay at the elan

Reviews.Title: “What's all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: estragon
Reviews.Content: After reading the rapturous reviews on TA, my expectations were sky high. The reality? A perfectly OK budget hotel, but nothing to write home about. First, the good. The service was first-rate. The staff were uniformly friendly, welcoming and competent. The bed in my first-floor room was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and well-maintained. Free wireless and a free printer in the business centre are definitely a step above the hotels that charge ten bucks a night for internet. And the 5-7 wine reception is a very nice touch. The not-so-good: The rooms are small, the decor is bland, and the hallways are especially ugly. The location? Other than the fact that there's a huge mall a block away, there's nothing to recommend it. The Elan Modern is on a bland stretch of Beverley Blvd., across from a Taco Bell and a greasy spoon. The hotel is only two storeys high, so most of the rooms are uncomfortably close to the street, which sometimes gets quite noisy. The buffet breakfast (included in the room rate) is OK, but it's served in the lobby, which on sunny days (this being L.A., that means most days) is uncomfortably hot, with barely any shade. So, bottom line: if I come to L.A. on vacation and need an inexpensive, centrally located place to stay, I'd consider the Elan again. If I am travelling on business, as I was this time around, no way.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably peaceful place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: Sistinas
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation in years, to visit my brother after he moved to LA, and spend Thanksgiving (and our birthdays) together. I had a huge fear of paying a ton of money to be treated like crap or have a bad experience, so I really sweated the hotel selection. I craved a modern decor and not a chain hotel, and leaned toward the Chamberlain for awhile, but eventually decided on the Elan thanks to the reivews on this site. I booked thru Travelocity and paid $155/night from Nov 19 to Nov 24, checking out on Nov 25. This was for the king sized bed suite. We could not have been happier with the entire experience. Though the room was not huge, it was perfectly adequate and comfortable for the two of us (and bro & gf) to lounge between activities. Dead quiet at night (we had a room off the back alley of the hotel), we slept great every night (wonderful linens). Only had the continental breakfast one day (6:30 to 10am) because we overslept the rest of the week. :D You had your choice of cereals, breads to toast, fruit, hardboiled eggs, juice and milk.
