And every evening from 5 to 7 was the wine and cheese tasting, which we frequented a lot more. :D We never got around to it, but you could also have massage in your hotel room. There is also a small work out room, but darn, never got in there either. ;P Did duck in once to use the business room computer for some directions, which we printed. Also, we had a balcony so the boys could go out and smoke...see pic...(all the other guest pix on this site have the rooms and other views covered) The staff was friendly and polite, especially Yolanda during check in. There is an ice machine in the basement right off the elevator, and several conveniences nearby. I joked that this hotel was my destiny, as there was a Taco Bell right across the street. We ate at Jan's Restaurant Sunday night because everything at Beverly Center was closed. Did finally break down one late night when getting back to the area, and got some Taco Bell. There is also the Mexican chain Alcupulco (sp?) and Norm's diner right around the corner. And to top it off, a gas station right up the street so we could feed our Pepsi/Mountain Dew fix in a town oversaturated with Coke products, and a drugstore right across the street from there, for all those little things we forgot. There is also a Jamba Juice, Baja Express and Souplantation right down the cross street (La Cienega I think). Do some exploring b/c there is plenty around the area, but it is nice and quiet at night so you can recover from the craziness that is LA during the day. When my brother moved out to LA, my dad spent $90 to stay in a Days Inn in the Studio City area, so I sure felt the Elan was worth it...despite the crazy drive over the canyon with my brother behind the wheel... I could not recommend it more, and would absolutely book there again if needing to be in the area...it was a great trip, and a lot of that was thanks to the cute little Elan Hotel Modern.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay at the Elan”
Reviews.Author: moodster
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here at the beginning of November and found it very pleasant. Staff were welcoming and helpful, the room was fairly large and clean, with a comfy bed. Turndown service was a nice touch, with a weather forecast and Hersheys left on the pillow. Nice bathroom too. Continental breakfast in the lobby was fine. Valet parking was quick and easy. Only downside was the noise from the road but it didn't stop me sleeping. I would recommend this place for being clean, comfortable, reasonably priced and in a pretty good location for getting around LA.

Reviews.Title: “Elan Excells”
Reviews.Author: kangas
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to L.A and stayed 3 wonderful nights at the Elan. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Elan when in LA, you will not be dissappointed. Location is great, access to all the tourist spots so easy - but most of all the service you will receive here will be second to none. Dave and Vance (front counter) Efrain (valet) you guys are the best and made our holiday !!! Will be back next year !!

Reviews.Title: “Reccommended”
Reviews.Author: John&Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 1 night, after flying to LA before travelling inland, quality place, clean and well maintained, exellent staff, enjoyed the wine with the mangers in the evening and the breakfast before setting off. Well priced and well located for exploring LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: nammer21
Reviews.Content: Deserves all the praise you read. Nice modern rooms, free internet, nice morning breakfast, helpful staff, great location in the middle of Beverly Hills. All for a great price. Can't go wrong choosing Elan.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: GJay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elan from 13th to 16th October and, as we liked it so much, returned there after our 5 day trip to Vegas for another 3 nights. Unassuming in appearance, the hotel scores heavily for its great location, spotlessly clean, classically designed and very comfortable bedrooms, and the friendliness of management and staff. Jorge and his colleagues on the front desk were a revelation with their untiring and enthusiastic help in recommending great restaurants, places to visit etc. And management were particularly helpful in letting us have a complimentary room post-check out to freshen up for our evening flight home after a long day enjoying the Southern Cal sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MHH1
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 night stay at the Elan Hotel in September.Location is convenient for all attractions-walking distance to Beverly Centre and simple drive to Hollywood,Farmers Market and Rodeo Dr.There is also a great diner across the road (Jans I think)and superb sushi bar 100 yards from the hotel.Staff were very knowledgable and friendly.Breakfast nice and cheese and wine in late afternoon very welcome after long day sightseeing.This really is a great value hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: DA6
Reviews.Content: We were passing through L.A. on our way to Europe from Australia and booked this hotel for 4 nights after reading the reviews here. It was a great choice. The close location to the Beverly Center made it easy to do some shopping or get around using the buses. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a deluxe King room, which was very tidy, clean, modern and comfortable (bed was great). The included breakfast was simple yet tasty and they also had a wine tasting evening which was free. If you're looking for a great place to eat, stay clear of Jan's Diner across the road and try the Madarette Chinese restaurant (just couple of streets to left of the hotel and Jan's). Definitely go to the Beverly Center to eat at the Grand Lux Cafe which was simply outstanding. All in all, highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location & understated charm”
Reviews.Author: DublinEoin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Elan Hotel Modern for two nights on September 24th & 25th based on the high rating in trip advisor and its convenient location. We were not to be disappointed. We tend to try and stay in places that are value for money but as close to the downtown area as possible and the Elan is definitely both. It represents good value by L.A. standards and it is a good central location between hollywood & beverly hills and therefore is convenient to any part of L.A. you might like to see. The breakfast was simple but elegant. A constantly refreshed supply of bagels, pastries, cereals, coffee, juice, boiled eggs etc. It is taken in the lobby area which is very atmospheric with big windows and simple furniture. A nice touch was the computer room with free internet (one computer). The staff were very helpful in a non-pushy way especially as our luggage arrived a day after us. The valet parking was handy and feel it was decent value and certainly we were clear up front on the cost. The valet himself was a very helpful guy. The room we had was clean and had everything you would expect in a modern hotel room. I didn't find the area particularly noisey and there are definitly decent resaurant options within walking distance - in one we even spotted a genuine celebrity (Jason Alexander from Seinfeld).

Reviews.Title: “The Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: sixfooteven
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Elan (Oct 6-9th). The staff was excellent, warm and considerate, they gave great advise and wanted to make our stay a lovely one. As for the hotel it was very clean, with lovely modern rooms and plush bedding and neutral colors. The room was a good size and we had a small balcony (201) that was nice. There is also a nice continental breakfast (whole fruit, cereal, breads and hard boiled eggs) and a wine and cheese hour in the evening. The hotel's location was wonderful, just half a block from the Beverly Center Mall (Hard Rock-Pf Chang and affordable shopping) we where also 10 minutes to the Sunset Strip (The Comedy Store and "celebrity owned" bars). Elan is a boutique hotel that works hard to live up to your needs and you feel appreciated. You get a lot for the great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elan”
Reviews.Author: SUSIEgir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan for nine nights in Sept, and absolutely loved it. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The beds in the room were very comfortable. You can walk to the Beverly Centre and restaurants and local transport is only a short walk as well. We used local transport to get around without any trouble. Jan's Restaurant is accross the road, which is a retro kind of Diner, but the food is excellent and it is very reasonably priced. There is a Wine and Cheese held each night Mon-Fri from 5-7pm and the breakfast each morning is just what you need to get you going. Loved the Granola for brekkie, but cannot find it in Aussie. We were offered a room to use on the last day at no extra charge as we were not leaving the hotel until 7pm. I would definelty stay at the Elan again. Sue Weston - Gold Coast Australia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gfgooner
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Elan Modern. On arrival the staff were friendly and welcoming. We stayed in a Deluxe King room which was stylishly decorated, very clean and had ample space. The staff couldn't have been more helpful in helping with everything from recommending restaurants for dinner, driving directions and even parking tips. Breakfast was included and offered a great choice of cereals, bagels, fruit etc. Finally, the hotel was in a great location, only a couple of miles from Beverly Hills and Sunset Strip. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: alcbkr
Reviews.Content: I do business with Cedars-Sinai Medical Center and this is a reasonably well priced hotel for the location. It is within walking distance of the Center. I donâ€™t like to drive when Iâ€™m in LA so the Elanâ€™s location is ideal. Close to work and close to shopping, etc. I have always had a clean room on the second floor. I have liked the continental breakfast and have never had a problem billing, service, etc. Although the coffee really isnâ€™t very good. Overall I rate them above average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jasonmelb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week long stay at the hotel. Could not fault it in any way. The staff, Location, Price.. I don't think it is possible to do any better. Miss it already, will return in 2008. Jason (Melbourne, Room 108)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Daso
Reviews.Content: If there is a hotel you want to stay at, then this hotel should be it. First of all, it is situated in the middle of everything. Most shops are within walking distance. The staffs service is Exceptional. The staff were advising us what to see and where to go. They Booked all of our tours. As for our last day there, the water boiler broke and we did not have hot water for about half an hour. So the management decided not to charge us for the food and drinks we took from the room fridge, which was about US$30. We had a flight that night, so the Management let us stay for free the extra few hours, giving us a new room so we can shower and relax before our flight. I rate this hotel 10/10 and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reserved again before checking out”
Reviews.Author: decaf123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elan in August and it was so great I booked it for my parents who were coming to the area the following weekend before checking out. Room: Sparkling clean, with a sort of retro-modern decor. Big and bright. Blackout shades made the room great for sleeping. Really, really comfortable bed & pillows. Individual thermostat to control a/c. Bathroom: Bright & super clean. Could use another shelf for toiletries. Lather bath products were fantastic. Staff: Friendly and welcoming. They went out of their way to accomodate us. Always said hello. Location: Great central location. Not too far from the Farmer's Market. Also possible to walk to some attractions which doesn't usually happen in L.A. Bonus: The free breakfast was great. Cereal, bagels & breads, yogurt & granola, fruit, hard boiled eggs, juice, milk & coffee. Area was constantly being cleaned and restocked. The wine and cheese on weekday afternoons was a nice addition as well. Overall: Will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: sm16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan for one night on the 29th August and although we had read the reviews which were positive for some reason we didnt no what to expect and a bit unsure. How wrong you can be!!!! Firstly I can confirm the staff are very friendly and helpfull. We asked for directions, advice on the area, local restaurants and they did all they could to help. Room was nice, clean and the bed was a nice large one. They had wine and cheese in the early evening which was a nice touch - you can help yourself to as much as you want. Breakfast was continental style in the main reception area which was well laid out and had plenty of choices. As a tourist it was well located near the Beverly centre and a short drive to Hollywood Blvd (chinese theatre park in the new shopping mall and get a discounted ticket), and a short drive to Rodeo Drive. Wish we had stayed a bit longer but will definatley use this hotel if we stay around the area in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Beardtours
Reviews.Content: Booked on the back of the positive reviews and wasnt disappointed. Given its location and features this place is really good value for money. The room was big and comfortable with a clean modern layout. The staff were helpful and friendly. Great location, theres some good restuarants, and the Beverley centre within walking distance. By car you can hit all the main sites pretty easily, congestion aside! If I come back to LA this is where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Elan”
Reviews.Author: captainI
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Elan. The staff provided excellent service. The rooms were neat and clean. The property was centrally located within a few miles from Holleywood, LA, and West LA. The Breakfast was plentyful and the hotel is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarryHornet
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the beginning of Aug with my family. This is a very nice smaller boutique style hotel. The room was clean and spacious, staff friendly and helpful. Convieniently located a short drive from most of the LA tourist attractions. Very good value for money. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddyToronto
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 days in Las Vegas my family and I needed some good old fashioned West Hollywood 'down time'. I found the Elan Hotel by chance online when looking for accommodations for our stay. What an absolute jewel! Walking distance from The Beverly Center, Melrose Avenue, and the Sunset Strip, we could not have picked a nicer, more pleasant place to stay. We arrived late and the front desk manager kept the complimentary wine and cheese out JUST FOR US! The entire hotel staff from room service to the guy parking the car were so incredibly friendly and helpful (helped us find our way around and even suggested places for dinner..). The bedrooms were so inviting and immaculately clean (loved the mints on the pillows) and the bathroom was spotless! (unfortunately no pictures to post...) We'll definately stay here again - it was an absolute delight. Best wishes to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: millypoppymo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, rooms to a very high standard. Staff were very professional and attentive. Breakfast buffet lovely. There are some good restaurants very near by, including an excellent vegan restaurant. Also very close by is the Beverly Shopping Center.

Reviews.Title: “Elan Modern..GREAT”
Reviews.Author: fish3d
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Elan for three nights. July 15, 16 17. I have never met a more attentive and nice staff in all my travels. We were here on business and the wireless internet and conference room was a great plus. The breakfast served in the lobby made our stay even easier. The coffee was fantastic. Our room ( # 105) was very quiet and had two double beds. There are literally dozens of excellent restaurants within a few minutes walk. The guests were an eclectic group and all were nice and friendly, I think the hotel attracts those types. Again the service was outstanding and the rooms extremely comfortable. We plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are great so are the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ilikecookies
Reviews.Content: The front of house staff are great at this hotel and couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Hotel is in a great location and the rooms are massive and very clean. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Elan Hotel Perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On last June we stayed for two nights on a triple room at Elan Hotel Modern. This hotel is fantastic. Very clean and modern rooms, very nice staff (front desk, valet parking), big bathroom, even for three persons in the room. The location is also a point. Walking distance from Beverly Center Mall and close to lot's of attractions. For sure we'll stay here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: paullv
Reviews.Content: My family went to California to celebrate my daughter's birthday and go to the American Girl Place at the Grove. The Elan Modern was a short distance away so we decided to stay there. Everyone on the staff was very friendly. The rooms were small but very clean and quiet. The location was excellent. In L.A. you definately need a car to get around. It is within walking to the Beverly Center shopping and a short drive to Hollywood. On our next trip to L.A., I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Elan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Elan for a week in April. My son-in-law booked it for us, so We had no idea what we would get. We loved it and would stay again any time we are in LA. The room was extremely clean and and pleasant. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was more than enough for anyone. The location was great for shopping or sight seeing. We always felt very safe there, and that is important for women traveling alone. The bedding was so comfortable, it felt like home. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: tvaddict2211
Reviews.Content: I recently visited LA for the first time, primarily for business. I spent my first three nights at the Elan, based on reviews on TripAdvisor and the recommendation of an associate. It was a pleasant experience from the start, with no problem checking in just after 8am - even having breakfast (love those bagels). That was a godsend, having left Australia 24 hours before. The staff were friendly and helpful and my room was immaculate each day, with replacement toiletries, shower hat etc. I make that point because at the trendy Beverly Hills hotel I moved to afterwards - not once did the toiletries get replenished in four nights. And that hotel was more expensive and had no breakfast or free internet. The shower curtain which is plastic on one side and towelling on the other is a brilliant idea - one of the rare times I've not had water leak everywhere in a hotel bathroom! I was travelling alone and found the Elan to be well located for dining and shopping. Even though I was told some places were too far to walk - if you have comfy shoes, it's not that far to places like the famed restaurant The Ivy on N. Robertson Blvd. Check out the hotel's website for special deals. The walls did seem a little thin but thankfully the vocal chap in the adjoining room went to sleep early. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find In Tinseltown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this small hotel online and booked directly with the front desk. The staff is well-trained and very helpful. They provided excellent directions and were very knowledgeable about the best places for shopping and dining. The hotel is very clean and the sheets and towels were top quality. I need high speed Internet access and the Elan provides wired and wireless Internet at no charge. They also include a free continental breakfast and overall this is a great value in a very nice part of Los Angeles. My wife likes to shop and she loved the location and felt very safe walking around the neighborhood. We checked several other hotels in this area and most were over $200 per night. I would recommend to business and leisure travelers. Not good for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Would return without question”
Reviews.Author: Texas-One
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern in January. We were in town for the Rose Bowl. After much looking we settled on the Elan based on customer reviews in Trip Advisor. We were extremely happy. The big differentiator was the service. I had a major migraine coming into LA and after getting our rental car we headed to the hotel at noon, 4 hours before check-in. We shared our concern that the rooms facing the street were noisier; the clerk took us to see each of the available three rooms and we took the one that suited us. In every instance when we asked the front desk folks for something, they were gratious, even going beyond the call of duty to retrieve milk for my wife at 1:00am. Our room was nicely appointed with one of the more comfortable beds I can remember in a hotel. It was a really great stay in a great location. The fact that Texas won the game made the weekend even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: What a great business hotel for the priceâ€¦ Called ahead and got a corporate rate of $150 and I must say, I was really pleased with this place. Great location, minutes away from Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, etc. Rooms are fine, not overly spacious, but generally well appointed. Nice, comfortable bed with quality linens. Good bath ammenities. Shower wasnâ€™t awesome but decent water pressure. Service was very effective. Valet parkingâ€”a mustâ€”only took mnutes for car to appearâ€¦Room rate includes free wireless internet(!), a good quality continental breakfast and a wine and cheese reception every evening. If there is anything lacking, it would be due the size. Because the hotel is small (~50 rooms), there is no bar or room serviceâ€¦but personally I prefer the cozy nature compared to over-priced, mediocre hotel food. Iâ€™d stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No complaints on this one - we spent three nights here recently and will definitely stay here again next time - excellent bkfst buffet, clean, attractive room (w/balcony & great view north). Good shopping, restaurants, etc. within walking distance. Helpful, pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, curteous front desk”
Reviews.Author: showshow57
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, right across from Beverly Center shopping center. Our room was small, and there was a spot in the room, where everyone in my family felt dizzy. Very strange. But not enough to complain. They have red/white wine and cheese reception in the evening. Too bad they did not have any soda or water for the kids, and they were not very quick to restock the food. The morning breakfast was quite good with fresh bagels, fruit newtons, and cereals. The workers are all in suits and very curteous.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return to Elan!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Elan was a great choice for our 3rd anniversary stay of 4 nights! We got a decent rate online, about $590. I goofed up and left my entire itinerary at home, but staying at Elan made our vacation a breeze. All of the employees were courteous and helpful. We were given a map upon check-in that we used thoughout our trip. The hotel is ideally located in Beverly Hills, close to Bev. Plaza, Rodeo Dr, Universal, Hollywood, the airport, etc. The ammenities were good for the price and very clean. Pay for the king bed...it's worth it! Parking is valet only and is $15/day. Continental breakfast was a good touch. We LOVED LA and will return and recommed Elan in the future (unless we upgrade to a luxury hotel). Next time we'll stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jurimo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and would stay there again as well as recommend it to friends. The hotel was great in terms of location, staff friendliness and all of the amenities available. The complimentary breakfast had a wide variety of choices, not like some offered at other places. It surpassed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and close to lots of shopping such as the Beverly Centre, it was a short walk to the Hard Rock Cafe, and also close to the famous 'Ivy Restaurant'. We flew from Sydney to LA, hired a car which we could park in the hotel and then we drove all over LA. The hotel was in a great location in relation to the hot spots such as Sunset Blvd, Beverly Hills and it wasnt too bad getting to the beaches either (if you can skip the peak hour traffic)! I was extremely pleased with the location and service. The rooms were nice and clean and the most convenient part about the rooms was the internet access !!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: novacc
Reviews.Content: The Elan is in West Hollywood, a great location. It's a funky, modern hotel with reasonable rates. They have valet parking, but we were always able to find metered parking right out front of the hotel. Loved the free Internet access in the business center. The complimentary breakfast was more than I expected with cereal (they put out the GOOD ones!), hard-boiled eggs, various breads, and fresh fruits. While the complimentary wine and cheese in the evening did not offer a huge selection of wines (1 merlot, 1 chardonnay), it was a nice touch. Our room (a standard double) was clean and comfortable. Despite being on a main street, it was very quiet. The bathroom was very spacious with modern fixtures, and the shower was awesome! Great water pressure and temperature. Robes were available, and the bathroom gels and shampoos smelled really nice. The beds had soft duvets and comfy pillows - not too hard, not too soft. The staff could not have been nicer. Rob, the concierge, was a big help with activities and restaurant reservations. This hotel is a great value. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple elegance - An oasis in LA”
Reviews.Author: BridgetF
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a hotel where people treat you with kindness and respect and you have a nice, clean, cheery room with high ceilings and simple clean designs, the Elan Hotel Modern is for you. It is the ultimate in convenience - business center, free internet, free breakfast and afternoon snack, nice workout room, super quick valet service and fantastic location where you can actually walk to interesting things! The rates are very reasonable in a neighborhood that has some expensive hotels like Le Meridien and Sofitel. After many years of looking, I am so happy to finally have a home away from home in LALA land at the Elan Hotel Modern!! Thank you tripadvisor for pointing me to the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the start of September. We spent ages trying to find a suitable hotel in LA. Every time we found one we liked most of the reviews weren't good. having read the reviews for this hotel we were initially unsure but it seemed to be in a good location for the things we wanted to do. We needn't have worried it was lovely staying here. We had a second floor room to the side of the hotel and it was perfect. You hear a slight noise from the traffic but nothing that bothered us. The room was clean and well presented. Each night we returned to the room the bed was turned down and the light and the radio were on. Also on each bed was a little note with a cartoon on it and telling us the weather forecast for the next day with 3 little chocolates. Nice touch. Breakfast was great. Cereal, rolls, bagels, bread, yoghurt, eggs, fruit, tea coffeeand orange juice. Just fine to start the day rather than going out searching for breakfast. The wine and cheese reception was all very informal and fine to have at the end of the day on returning to the hotel. However it is from 5 to 7pm and may be a bit early for some. This was a perfect location for visiting Hollywood, Universal (only about 20min drive) and Santa Monica. The Beverly centre is just two blocks away. There is a 24 hr pharmacy nearby which sells a bit of everything. There are also several restaurants in the near vicinity. The staff were all very helpful and Pablo one of the car valet staff was always so cheery. The only negative thing I would like to mention was that the matress cover was loose and the bottom sheet on the bed was rather short and I had to remake the bed each night to make it comfortable. All in all we fully reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay in the "City of Angels"”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Berlin
Reviews.Content: Read the June 2, 2005, review which is a very accurate description of this excellent hotel. I would like to add the fact that you have Wireless Internet access in all rooms for free and that the staff was great. Try to get a room that is not facing Beverly Blvd. The Blvd is very noisy in the morning and in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: aquadotto
Reviews.Content: Read the June 2, 2005, review which is a very accurate description of this excellent little hotel. The only thing I would add is how impressed we were by the professional and courteous service. Stayed four nights and didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Style”
Reviews.Author: PT1976
Reviews.Content: This place was an awesome slice of LA style - cool colors, funky, laid-back. Not cookie-cutter at all - this place was not a chain and it didn't feel like you could be anywhere except LA. We booked a package through them for 360 total which included two nights, museum tickets, fanastic fresh breakfast, and $60 towards dinner at a nearby trattoria. The breakfast was hands down the best complimentary hotel breakfast I have ever seen - granola, wheat bread, bagels, real bakery pastries, fruit, fruit, fruit, great coffee. Bed was super-comfortable with high thread count linens. Bathroom was tiny but acceptable, bathrobes a nice touch. Common areas looked like they were either being renovated or in need of renovation but all in all, the Elan puts money into important stuff (bed, linens, funky decor, breakfast) and as for the rest, who cares if the hallway looks a little shabby. Finally, the front desk was phe-nomenal. I'm not usually a P.I.T.A. but I was without a car in LA and wanted to go to off-the-beaten-track places like Japantown and they helped me find bus routes to these random places even though they didn't know where they were - which means they took the time to research my P.I.T.A. requests - all with a smile. Finally, on the last night, I had planned to use my restaurant voucher but the place was closed on Monday nights and the front desk scored me a voucher to another restaurant even though we didn't make reservations like we were supposed to. They also arranged our super shuttle for us and had them wait for us when we were tied up at dinner. These people gave us 5-star service for a 2 star price. If their manager is reading, Jorge and Jordan deserve a raise. They were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Opaque but not bad for the price.”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: After I read the reviews of the Elan on Trip Advisor and in several publications, I expected an incredibly hip hotel experience. Perhaps my expectations were too high certainly considering we didn't pay a whole lot. The room was rather bland filled with IKEA type furniture. Perhaps this where the "hip" quotient arrives from. Yet, this furniture is not holding up well and is showing signs of wear and tear. The bathroom was styled nicely in an inexpensive manner and looked like something a young up and coming couple would have in their first apartment The staff was friendly in that L.A. way letting you know that this hotel job is just temporary until their acting skills are discovered. The entire hotel experience was rather opaque reflecting on the entire hotel's ambience. The neighborhood is not too bad, within walking distance of Melrose etc. But, I forgot, nobody walks in L.A.! We were rather incongruous as we strolled down Beverly Blvd. If you can get a really low price, the Elan Modern Hotel is not too bad. It's just rather opaque.........Whatever that means.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: beachydr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Elan for 2 nights - in town for business. It is very sad if this is one of the top hotels in LA...b/c frankly it was not good AT ALL!! The room I was given at first was on the main floor and was sooo loud, it was ridiculous!! The bed comforter had stains all over and so did the carpet and headboard. The carpet edges were brown with dirt and were very frayed and tattered. Overall the room was very old and worn looking - marks all over the wall etc. - much in need of a reno. The garbage had not been cleaned out from the previous guest and there were hairs in both the sink and all over the tub. The room framework ie. bed, comforter headboard(as seen in pics) looks nice but it is deceiving. I asked to switch to a clean and quieter room. The front desk was not very understanding or helpful. I'm sure this was a nice hotel 5 to 10 yrs ago but now it is just old looking. Note: The main areas are better maintained than the rooms and beds are comfortable. When they finally allowed me to switch to a 2nd floor room it was only slightly better - still fairly noisy (all though not nearly as bad) but again the room was old, worn and stained. There were also hairs in the shower of this room! I will definitely not stay here again even though the location is great, price is good and the cocktail hour and breakfast were good - cleanliness is very poor and that is much more important to me!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: Catullus1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent domestic and international travellers who have visited LA often in recent years. After an extended cruise we just spent three thoroughly enjoyable nights at the Elan Modern and cannot be more positive in our evaluation of the establishment and its services. This is a terrific boutique-style hotel at a great location for dining, shopping, night life and just getting around LA. Our very spacious room with king size bed and large bathroom was tastefully decorated in muted tones with fixtures and furniture of Art Deco/Moderne design. A nice touch was the availability of a local restaurant listing delineated by ethnicity, location and price, complemented by an abundance of recent periodicals reviewing current tourist attractions and museum shows, as well as additional dining and shopping possibilities. Bedroom and bathroom linens and toiletries were of the highest caliber and a DSL connection (which we did not need on this occasion) was available in the room, while internet access (which I did use) and a printer (handy for keeping directions to the Getty and other tourist attractions) were available in the lobby's business center/lounge. The hotel's clientele was quite diverse: straight couples, gay couples, business people and singles. With West Hollywood nearby the hotel was clearly gay-friendly. Valet parking was swift and efficient ($14.50 per 24 hrs.), with its own underground garage which minimized waiting time (almost none). The included continental breakfast was a cornucopia of choices: hot and cold beverages, fruit, cereals, eggs (hard boiled), toast and muffins. The services of the front desk and the housekeeping staff could not have been more friendly, welcoming, courteous and helpful. The management of the Elan Modern clearly understands the tastes and needs of its clientele and delivers the goods. This a a fabulous find! We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic style, privacy and convenience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern on Beverly Blvd., in Los Angeles, near Bevery Hills. It was within walking distance of the Cedars-Sinai Hospital complex and the decorating district on Beverly, and within a short drive to Hollywood, Sunset Blvd, and La Brea. The styling inside and out is a delightful modern version of the late 1950s-early 1960s. The accomodations are all one needs, with an emphasis on privacy. Continental breakfast was delicious, and the staff was both friendly and accommodating. The facade is modest and inconspicuous, and is thus a perfect spot for one seeking to be in town without a lot of attention. Evidently, Matt Damon selects the property for that quality, and I would agree. Prices are reasonable, esp. for LA. My expectations are simple, and set low by too many nights in hotel rooms that all appear the same, down to the TV remote. This hotel will make you comfortable, not cost you too much, and you will feel you are in a memorable place. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Aims for style but wins on substance”
Reviews.Author: JohnInLouisville
Reviews.Content: To paraphrase a prior review, you may very well indeed think â€œuh-ohâ€� at first sight of the Elan. The hotel is pretty small, and although theyâ€™ve updated the place to give it a hip vibe, itâ€™s still pretty easy to discern that the building itself is getting on in years. When we were greeted promptly at the curb by a friendly valet, however, and then by the professional front desk staff, our minds were soon put at ease. Although our deluxe king room was on the small side, it was quiet, clean, and comfortable. The somewhat overwrought dÃ©cor of the hotelâ€™s public areas thankfully did not extend to the rooms which were still modern in design but more subdued. Even though our room was facing Beverly Boulevard, we were not kept awake by traffic noise save for an occasional siren (the hotel is a few blocks from Cedars Sinai Medical Center) which I doubt even the best soundproofing technology could have stifled. Linens were of high quality and soft; bed was firm. The closet comes with lots of shelf space which was so useful! Could hear some occasional chatter coming from an adjoining room but nothing too disrupting. Bathroom was small but adequateâ€”for some reason we seemed to have problems with water splashing up and pooling on the basinâ€™s countertop. The lobbyâ€™s retro-modern design came across as a bit cold and echoey; carpeting would have helped. The floor-to-ceiling windows were compelling but offered little more than a view of the Taco Bell across the street. The continental breakfast served in the lobby was akin to what you might get at a Hampton or Best Western which, for us, was preferable to gorging on pancakes and eggs every morning anyway. Free internet access in the small business center right off the lobby was handy for checking e-mail or printing boarding passes. The elevator was slow and a little crude. Hotelâ€™s hallways were a bit dark and narrow. The location of the Elan is good. The hotelâ€™s small size makes stepping out of your room and going places a snap, unlike larger hotels which sometime require an act of Congress just to reunite you with your car again. Beverly Center shopping and restaurants are only a 2 or 3 block walk away. Several other decent restaurants were within walking distance. There is also a huge Rexall drug store a block away for all those items you forgot to bring with you on your trip. Beverly Hills, CBS studios, and all the Hollywood attractions are a 5-minute driveâ€”10 minutes tops. My companion and I did manage to walk to West Hollywood from the hotel, which is quite a trek but manageable if youâ€™re up to it. (I suggest taking Beverly to Robertson rather than walking straight up La Cienega to Santa Monica Boulevard should you decide to walk it. Itâ€™s a shorter and a much more pleasant stroll.) All in all, once we got past the facilityâ€™s age and some of the cheesy dÃ©cor, we really liked the Elan. Service and amenities alone made our stay a good deal for the money. Weâ€™d definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific secret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed at the Elan Hotel Modern. I went on business and was only there for two days. The hotel is located on the southern tip of Beverly Hills and near a huge shopping mall. It has valet service for your car and impeccable service throughout. The lobby is filled with sunshine and is a nice place to eat a complimentary breakfast (excellent, by the way), catch up on your voice mails, read the paper, or plan out your Los Angeles day. The hotel is more suited for business travelers because it's not immediately close to touristy spots. But, if you have a car and a map, it's a great deal. The accommodations have a small conference room with complimentary computer and Internet access. When I was there, a group of business people had reserved the conference room for the morning and were conducting a meeting. The rooms are very nice: clean, lovely linens and bedcovers, a soft robe, complimentary luxury shampoos and lotions, nice and new furniture, good bathroom lighting, a refrigerator with snacks you can pay for, and more. I was lucky -- I had a room toward the back of the hotel on the second floor, which was ultra quiet. I paid a few dollars less ($135.00/night) than the cheapest you could find online because I called the hotel directly to book, asking for the best rate available. If I need to stay in L.A. again, this is where I will land.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: given the cheap rates and the location, i thought this place would be disappointing. not at all! the room was exceptionally clean-- with taste, good design, and a thoughtful approach (including high speed internet in the room, good soap/shampoo in the bathroom, unoffensive decor... i usually hate hotel rooms). the linens were cool. the room was quiet, fresh, well lit. it's on a busy street lined wtih taco bell and other multinationals, but if that doesn't bother you it actually has a good location, near all of the places you might want to see in beverly hills. it's quick to get a taxi. from what i could tell, there were no good bars or restaurants in the immediate vicinity, but i didn't really spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Elan, and once again I was very satisified. The staff is very helpful, but free parking would be nice (it's an additional $14.50). The hotel was nicely decorated and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden secret of Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: Scot_Wha's_Away
Reviews.Content: As your taxi draws up outside the Elan Modern, you could be forgiven for thinking "Uh oh!". But behind the worst-of-the-sixties architecture lies a little gem of a hotel with a level of service and the kind of personal touches usually reserved for the most expensive upscale chains. The hotel plays subtly on that sixties look throughout its very 21st century operation: the reception staff are dressed in fawn suits and crew neck sweaters; the lobby is furnished in modern retro; even the name evokes the era of Englebert Humperdinck and Frankie Vaughn. The rooms are a real pleasure. There are only about 20 of them, on two floors, and they are furnished in relaxing creams and browns. Toiletries are top quality, and are presented pocketed in folded towels. A dressing gown hangs on the bathroom door. There's a minibar and a stock of snacks, but you're unlikely to go hungry, because the Elan Modern includes a buffet breakfast in the very reasonable price: cereals, eggs, bagels, muffins and yogurt without the usual $15 added to the bill. Now to what's not perfect. The rooms are centered around a little inner courtyard, and for inexplicable reasons, they leave a bright light on in the yard all night. This means your room is never dark, and in fact, I ended up hanging a bath towel over the top of the curtains to block out the glare. The obsession with bright light extends to the fitness room which is oppressively overlit; it's also pretty basic, but there's a proper gym just along the road if you want a more extensive selection of kit. Despite the irritations this hotel is hard to beat, whether you're a tourist or business traveller. The attractions of Beverley Hills - the shops of Rodeo Drive and the bars and restaurants of Santa Monica Boulevard - are just minutes away, and it's a short drive to the Hollywood hills and the film studios which are a must see for every tourist. You won't go wrong basing an LA visit here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fonz333
Reviews.Content: We never guessed how cool this place would be, especially considering the price and location. It's very comfortable, although the rooms are small, and the decor is very cool. 600-count egyptian cotton sheets to boot. Within walking distance to the Beverly Center, real nice spread for the continental breakfast, and extremely friendly staff. It doesn't look like a hotel from the outside, so we actually drove past it a couple of times before we found it. This is my hotel of choice when I stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place suits my needs for a stay in la. Clean fresh down pillows and comforters are a delight to find in this price range! (Relieves my fear of nasty chain hotel bedspreads.) No frills, other than the afore mentioned linens, but a lovely quiet cosy place to call home in a great location as a bonus. Highly recommend, and that is a compliment!

Reviews.Title: “Top Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and from the minute we walked through the door, the staff exceeded our expectations. They were always helpful and honest and went beyond their call of duty to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The complimentary breakfast is wonderful and our rooms were always left immaculate. The free internet was also a nice bonus. If we return to LA we will definitely stay here again.
